column12: Improvements in Projectiles.
column13: 100,046. Semple, J. B. Feb. 3, 1915, [Convention date]. Addition to 100,030. Projectile fuses.-Relates to safety-devices for fuses of high-explosive projectiles, of the kind described in the parent Specification, in which means: are provided for interrupting or making continuous a detonation-imparting pathway from the detonator to the bursting-charge. According to this invention, the continuity of the pathway is controlled by a plurality of members movable in different directions. In the arrangement shown, spring-pressed centrifugally-acting members 6, which overlap each other, are arranged in a space 3 across the passage 13 which connects the detonator D to the bursting-charge B. When the projectile is fired from a gun, the members 6 fly outwards in opposite directions, bringing passages 12 filled with suitable detonation-transmitting material into alinement with the passage 13. A spring catch or the like retains the members 6 in the armed position. Specification 6351/15 is referred to.
column15: SEMPLE JOHN BONNER

column12: Improvements in Projectiles.
column13: 12,860. Sample, J. B. June 5. Fuzes for projectiles.-The body 3 carries at its forward end the usual percussion hammer 4 and primer 1. The rear part of the body contains a pyrotechnic composition 6 and a friction pin 9. When the gun is fired, the powder gases pass around the pin 9, and fill the chamber 7, expanding the cup 11. When the projectile leaves the gun, the expansion of the gases in the chamber 7 drives away the discs 12, 8 and the pin 9, thus igniting the pyrotechnic composition 6, which produces a trail of flame to show the path of the projectile. In smaller projectiles, the body 3 extends outside the base, and the outer disc 12 is omitted. Specification No. 4776, A.D. 1902, is referred to.

column12: Improvements in and relating to Means for Indicating the Trajectory of Projectiles.
column13: 16,288. Semple, J. B. Aug. 10. Indicating distance traversed by projectiles.-In the device shown, a hollow projectile is partly filled with a material such as lamp-black, alone or mixed with water, for daylight use, or zinc ethyl, or a solution of phosphorus in carbon bisulphide, for use at night. On discharge, the powder gases under high pressure enter the projectile through the tube 4, and their subsequent exit is prevented by the material, which by centrifugal force is held against the walls of the projectile, and surrounds the end of the tube. When the projectile leaves the bore of the gun, the external pressure falls, and the expansion of the trapped gases forces the material through the tube. In modifications, (1) the material is carried in a hollow plug, screwed into the base of an explosive projectile, (2) the pressure is generated internally, on discharge, by the ignition of combustible material by a percussion fuze, (3) a spring plunger is used to force the material through an axial perforation, and (4) the material is expelled by a combined scooping and siphoning action.
column15: SEMPLE JOHN BONNER

column12: Improvements in Devices for Tracing the Flight of Projectiles.
column13: 11,252. Semple, J. B. May 12. Indicating trajectories of projectiles.-Fuses for igniting a tracing material, operated by the pressure of the gases when the gun is fired, are so constructed that the primer and the firing-pin are normally held at a distance apart, and one of them is carried by a part capable of being flexed by the pressure. In the form shown in Fig. 1, the tracing material is arranged in a plug 2, the primer 3 is placed against it, and the firing-pin 6 is carried by a disk 5 capable of flexure and held away from the primer by a ring 7 formed integral with the primer block. The primer block may rest against a shoulder in the plug 2. A metal cup 8 may be placed at the back of the disk 5 to form a gas-check; a plastic material such as a lead or rubber washer may also be interposed between the cup and the disk. A perforated plate 10 protects the device from damage in ramming. The device may be disposed in a recess in the projectile instead of in a plug attached thereto.

column12: Improvements in Projectiles.
column13: 100,030. Semple, J. B. Jan. 29, 1915, [Convention date]. Projectile fuses.-Relates to safety-devices for fuses of high-explosive projectiles, and consists in providing means for interrupting or making continuous a train of detonation-imparting material extending from the detonator to the bursting- charge. In the arrangement shown, the detonator D, usually consisting of fulminate of mercury, is separated from a secondary detonating-charge B, which usually consists of tri-nitro-tolnene. and can be regarded as part of the bursting-charge, by a heavy partition. The detonator-holder is within a closed safety-chamber 14. Through the partition runs a passage 13, filled with a substance capable of transmitting detonation, such as trinitro-tolnene, and thin septa of metal may be arranged at intervals across the passage. The passage is interrupted by a slide 6, normally retained at the inner end of a transverse hole 3, as shown, by centrifugal bolts 4. When the projectile is fired from a gun, the bolts release the slide 6, which thereupon is moved outwards by centrifugal force, so that a circular groove 12, also filled with detonation-transmitting material, completes the path between the detonator D and the charge B. A locking-member 7 may be provided to retain the slide 6 automatically in the outer position. Specification 6351/15 is referred to.
column15: SEMPLE JOHN BONNER

column12: Improvements in Projectiles.
column13: 6351. Semple, J. B. April 29, 1914, [Convention date]. Projectile fuses.-Relates to percussion fuses of the kind in which the detonator is normally held away from the bursting-charge of the projectile in such a way that, if the detontor is accidentally exploded, the detonation will not be transmitted to the bursting- charge, the detonator being brought towards the bursting-charge in the operative position during the flight of the projectile. According to the invention, the detonator is moved to the operative position by centrifugal force. In the fuse shown, the detonator D is normally held at safe in the position, indicated in Figs. 1 and 2, by spring bolts 4. During flight, the bolts 4 move out under centrifugal force and release the detonator, which, in its turn, is moved by centrifugal force towards the right of Fig. 2, where it is near the intermediate detonating-charge 13 by which detonation is communicated to the bursting-charge of the projectile. In this position, the detonator is also in communication with the percussion igniter 8 of the fuse through Hash passages 11 ; and recoil of the detonator is prevented by pieces 7, which, under centrifugal force, move behind the detonator when this advances.
column15: SEMPLE JOHN BONNER

column12: Improvements in and relating to Fuses for Projectiles.
column13: 21,944. Semple, J. B. Oct. 12. Fuzes for projectiles; detonators. - The fuzes are arranged to be unarmed until the gun is fired. Figs. 2 and 3 show the fuze unarmed and armed respectively. Within a recess of the body 3 is a hammer 4 with a longitudinal opening for the rod 5 and the firing-pin 6. The firing-pin 6 is attached by a wire 7 to the hammer 4 and in the unarmed position is kept inclined by bearing against the block 9. When the gun is fired, the hammer 4 shears the wire 10 and moves to the rear, bringing the firing-pin 6 opposite the cap 8, ready to be advanced by the hammer as soon as the projectile strikes. The detonating - charge is carried in a cap 19 which fits over an extension of the block 9. In modifications, (a), Fig. 4, the firing-pin is normally out of line with the cap 8 and is brought by a spring into line when the hammer 4 is thrown back, (b), Fig. 5, the firing-pin 6 is fixed and the cap made movable, and (c), Fig. 6, a friction composition placed under the thin plate 25 is ignited by amorphous phosphorus on the outside of the plate which is carried through by the firing-pin when it pierces the plate.

column12: Improvements in Projectiles.
column13: 103,821. Semple, J. B. Jan. 13, 1916, [Convention date]. Projectiles; projectile fuses.-Relates to handgrenades of the kind in which the striker of the fuse is normally held back by a nut, which is unscrewed during the flight of the grenade. According to the invention, the nut is unscrewed by the drag of a tail attached to one side of the nut. In the form shown in Fig. 2, the grenade comprises a grooved cylindrical body 1 containing an explosive charge adapted to be fired by a detonator d with a short time-fuse p ignited by a percussion cap c. This cap is struck by a spring hammar 4, which is released during flight by the unscrewing of a nut 7 by the drag produced on it by a cloth tail 8, the hammer being compelled to rotate with the grenade body by a pin and hole 14, 15. The nut is locked against accidental removal by a cotter pin 12, which may be constituted by the fore end of the wire 9 connecting the nut 7 to the tail 8, the wire being previously wound round the grenade. The time-fuse p is vented by holes 16, 17. In a modification, the spring 13 of the hammer is replaced by a weak spring between the hammer and the cap, and the time fuse is omitted; the hammer then strikes the cap on impact. The hammer in this case is made to rotate with the grenade by a side pin and groove.

column12: Improvements in Projectiles
column13: 4776. Semple, J. B. Feb. 25. Fuzes for projectiles.-The object is to cause the fuze composition to be ignited after the projectile has left the gun. In the form shown in Fig. 2, the base 1 of the projectile is provided with a plate 8, which forms a chamber 4 behind the plate 7 covering the fuze composition 2. A friction primer 6 is connected to the plate 8, but the connection is a loose one. When the powder gases act on the projectile to carry it down the gun, they pass around the primer 6 into the chamber 4, but as soon as the projectile leaves the gun, the withdrawal of the pressure from the outer face of the plate 8 causes the plate to be carried away, thus moving the friction primer 6 and igniting first the fulminate in the cap and then the fuze composition 2. In the modification shown in Fig. 4, the fuze composition is carried in a number of chambers 2<a>, each provided with its own percussion cap 14 and hammer 13, the hammers being normally protected by a sleeve 12 which is carried outwards to the stop 6<a> by the internal pressure, as soon as the projectile leaves the gun.

column13: 11,458. Semple, J. B. May 14. Indicating trajectories of projectiles.-Relates to a percussion fuse for igniting a tracing material, and comprises a fixed member 5, which normally closes the chamber containing the material, a member 4 which sets back when the projectile is discharged from the gun, a firing-pin 7 carried by one of these members, and a priming-cap 3. The igniting device and the tracing material A are disposed in a recess in the projectile or in a plug 1 screwed thereto. The member 4 is held against accidental movement by a thin ring 9, and the fixed member 5 is made gas-tight by a cup-shaped or other seal 8. In a modification, the cap is carried by the member 5, and the firing-pin by the member 4, suitable ports being provided in these members for the passage of the flash. In another modification, the cap is placed in front of the member 4 and ignited by a friction pin carried by this member. Specification 16,288/05 is referred to.

column12: Drive configuration
column13: Some embodiments are directed to a drive configuration for a skid-steered vehicle that has a pair of traction motors for rotationally driving opposite outputs of the drive configuration. The traction motors are operatively connected to the outputs via respective gearing arrangements for selectively varying gear reduction between each of the traction motors and the corresponding output. The drive configuration also has a steer differential in a torque connection with the first and second outputs of the drive configuration. The drive configuration additional has a steer motor operatively connected to the steer differential for selectively varying the rotational speed of the first and second outputs in use. Also, the traction and steer motors define a volume in which the gearing arrangements and steering differential are at least partially located.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: Drive configurations for skid steered vehicles
column13: A drive configuration (10B) for a skid steered vehicle comprises first and second torque outputs (14L, 14R) coupled by a differential (13) and in a torque connection with first and second electric motors (12L, 12R), the differential being configured to mechanically transfer power across itself; and a mechanical power splitter (48L) having a first torque transfer feature (54L) in a torque connection with a combustion engine (35), a second torque transfer feature (50L) in a torque connection with a respective additional electric motor (52L) and a third torque transfer feature (49L) in a torque connection with at least one of the first and second torque outputs (14L) of the drive configuration, wherein torque output from the or each said mechanical power splitter (48, 48R) in use is dependenton torques generated by the combustion engine (35) and the associated additional electric motor (52L).

column12: 드라이브 구성
column13: 스키드 조향 차량을 위한 드라이브 구성은, 드라이브 구성의 반대의 출력들을 회전 구동하기 위한 한 쌍의 견인 모터(102)로서, 견인 모터는 상기 각각의 견인 모터와 상기 대응하는 출력 사이의 기어 감속을 선택적으로 변화시키기 위한 각각의 기어링 장치(104)를 통해 출력(113)들에 동작 가능하게 연결되는, 한 쌍의 견인 모터; 드라이브 구성의 제1 및 제2 출력들과의 토크 연결로 있는 조향 차동 장치(110); 및 사용시에 제1 및 제2 출력들의 회전 속도를 선택적으로 변화시키기 위해 조향 차동 장치에 동작 가능하게 연결된 조향 모터(106)를 포함하며; 견인 및 조향 모터들은 기어링 장치 및 조향 차동 장치가 적어도 부분적으로 위치되는 볼륨을 한정한다.

column12: DIFFERENTIAL
column13: A differential (10) comprising: a left-side planetary gear set (12L) having a sun gear (16 L) configured to receive rotational drive input from a drive source (20), a ring gear (22 L) in a torque connection with an electric motor (26) and a carrier gear (14 L) configured to be operatively coupled with a left-side vehicle drive member (30 L) in a torque connection; a right-side planetary gear set (12 R) having a sun gear (16 R) configured to receive rotational drive input from the drive source (20), a ring gear (22 R) in a torque connection with the electric motor (26) and a carrier gear (14 R)configured to be operatively coupled with a right-side vehicle drive member (30 R) in a torque connection; wherein the sun gears (16L, 16 R) of the left and right side planetary gear sets (12 L,12 R)are rotationally fixed relative to each other and, in use, the amount of power transferred between the drive source (20) and each of the respective drive members (30 L, 30 R) can be selectively controlled by operating the electric motor (26) to drive or apply torque to the ring gears (22 L, 22 R) in opposite directions.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: Configuraciones de accionamiento para vehículos con dirección deslizante
column13: Una configuración (10) de accionamiento para un vehículo con dirección deslizante, que comprende: salidas (14) de torque primera y segunda que están acopladas por un diferencial (13) y en una conexión de torque con motores (12) eléctricos primero y segundo respectivamente, en donde el diferencial (13) está configurado para transferir potencia mecánicamente a través de sí mismo y comprende: un par de conjuntos (20) de engranajes planetarios externos y un par de conjuntos (30) de engranajes planetarios internos, ambos pares dispuestos entre el primer y segundo motores (12) eléctricos, estando dispuesto el par de conjuntos (30) de engranajes planetarios internos entre (es decir, alojados dentro) el par de conjuntos (20) de engranajes planetarios externos; el par de conjuntos (20) de engranajes planetarios externos comprende: un par de soportes (22) planetarios externos dispuestos para girar con los respectivos árboles (14) de salida; un par de engranajes (18) solares externos dispuestos para girar con los respectivos rotores de los motores (12) de propulsión; y, un par de engranajes (24) de anillo externos, acoplados operativamente entre sí mediante una disposición de engranajes que solo permite que los engranajes (24) de anillo externos giren entre sí de manera igual y opuesta; el par de conjuntos (30) de engranajes planetarios internos que comprende: un par de soportes (32) planetarios internos interconectados por un árbol (34) transversal de manera que los soportes (32) giran en común; un par de engranajes (26) de anillo internos dispuestos para girar con los respectivos árboles (14) de salida; y, un par de engranajes (36) solares internos, en donde al menos un engranaje (36) solar está acoplado operativamente a la disposición de engranajes y, bien el otro engranaje (36) solar interno también está acoplado operativamente a la disposición de engranajes de modo que los engranajes (36) solares internos giran entre sí de manera igual y opuesta, o el otro engranaje (36) solar interno está fijo estacionario.

column12: FERNSEHPROGRAMMVERTEILSYSTEM
column13: A novel advanced set top terminal capable of digital decompression, menu generation, interactivity and other advanced functional capabilities for use in a television program delivery system (200) is described. The invention relates to methods and apparatus for upgrading existing set top terminals (220) to provide menu generation capability and advanced functional capabilities. The invention is particularly useful in television program delivery systems (200) with hundreds of channels of programming, providing (i) menu driven program selection through the addition of an upgrade module (300) or menu generation card and (ii) advanced functional capabilities using a set of hardware upgrades (e.g., 130) and/or an expansion card. Specifically, the invention is an upgradeable system that supports advanced set top functionality through the use of internal software, hardware upgrades, an upgrade module and/or expansion cards. The upgraded hardware generally includes a microprocessor, various input/output ports (e.g., 308), processing circuitry (e.g., 108) and memory (e.g., 116). The invention results in an upgraded set top terminal that supports: menu generation; picture-on-picture displays; program catalogue services; interactive services; telephone caller identification; digital audio reception; VCR control; HDTV reception; and backyard satellite system interoperability, among other features and capabilities.

column12: APPARATUS FOR MANAGING FLUID FLOW IN A VEHICLE
column13: Apparatus for managing fluid flow in a vehicle, comprising: an epicylic gear set having first and second inputs configured to receive rotational drive input from a torque output feature of a powertrain and a rotary actuator respectively; a pump driver for driving a fluid pump, the pump driver configured to receive rotational drive input from an output of the epicylic gear set; and a controller configured to determine information corresponding to the rotational speed of the torque output feature using information generated by a rotational speed sensor and based on this control the rotary actuator such that the pump driver is caused to rotate at substantially a pre-specified speed.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: Television program delivery system
column13: A novel advanced set top terminal capable of digital decompression, menu generation, interactivity and other advanced functional capabilities for use in a television program delivery system (200) is described. The invention relates to methods and apparatus for upgrading existing set top terminals (220) to provide menu generation capability and advanced functional capabilities. The invention is particularly useful in television program delivery systems (200) with hundreds of channels of programming, providing (i) menu driven program selection through the addition of an upgrade module (300) or menu generation card and (ii) advanced functional capabilities using a set of hardware upgrades (e.g., 130) and/or an expansion card. Specifically, the invention is an upgradeable system that supports advanced set top functionality through the use of internal software, hardware upgrades, an upgrade module and/or expansion cards. The upgraded hardware generally includes a microprocessor, various input/output ports (e.g., 308), processing circuitry (e.g., 108) and memory (e.g., 116). The invention results in an upgraded set top terminal that supports: menu generation; picture-on-picture displays; program catalogue services; interactive services; telephone caller identification; digital audio reception; VCR control; HDTV reception; and backyard satellite system interoperability, among other features and capabilities.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN;;BONNER ALFRED

column12: DRIVE CONFIGURATION
column13: Some embodiments are directed to a drive configuration for a skid-steered vehicle that has a pair of traction motors for rotationally driving opposite outputs of the drive configuration. The traction motors are operatively connected to the outputs via respective gearing arrangements for selectively varying gear reduction between each of the traction motors and the corresponding output. The drive configuration also has a steer differential in a torque connection with the first and second outputs of the drive configuration. The drive configuration additional has a steer motor operatively connected to the steer differential for selectively varying the rotational speed of the first and second outputs in use. Also, the traction and steer motors define a volume in which the gearing arrangements and steering differential are at least partially located.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: APPARATUS FOR MANAGING FLUID FLOW IN A VEHICLE
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: A DIFFERENTIAL
column13: Some embodiments are directed to a differential including: a left-side planetary gear set having a sun gear configured to receive rotational drive input from a drive source, a ring gear in a torque connection with an electric motor and a carrier gear configured to be operatively coupled with a left-side vehicle drive member in a torque connection; a right-side planetary gear set having a sun gear configured to receive rotational drive input from the drive source, a ring gear in a torque connection with the electric motor and a carrier gear configured to be operatively coupled with a right-side vehicle drive member in a torque connection; wherein the sun gears of the left and right side planetary gear sets are rotationally fixed relative to each other and, in use, the amount of power transferred between the drive source and each of the respective drive members can be selectively controlled.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: Drive configurations for skid steered vehicles
column13: Some embodiments are directed to a controlled differential adapted to couple two shafts and steer input, such as those provided in a drive configuration for a skid steered vehicle, the controlled differential including a pair of planet carriers arranged to turn with respective shafts; a pair of ring gears interconnected by a cross-shaft such that the ring gears rotate in common; planet gears and a pair of sun gears, the sun gears being coupled to at least one steer motor to enable rotation of the sun gears in mutually opposite senses upon input from the steer motor.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: An electric motor
column13: An electric motor comprising: a stator comprising a plurality of circumferentially distributed drive elements for causing an electromagnetic driving force to be applied to a rotor of the electric motor in use, wherein each drive element comprises a wire extending around a metal core to define a plurality of coils for magnetizing the metal core when current flows in the coils, and wherein at least one space exists between the metal core of each respective drive element and the coils around it; and cooling means for transferring heat away from the drive elements; wherein each said drive element further comprises a heat conductor comprising a plurality of mutually electrically isolated metallic elements located in the or each respective space between the metal core thereof and the coils around it, for transferring heat from the coils to the cooling means.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: DRIVE CONFIGURATIONS FOR SKID STEERED VEHICLES
column13: A drive configuration (10B) for a skid steered vehicle comprises first and second torque outputs (14 L , 14 R ) coupled by a differential (13) and in a torque connection with first and second electric motors (12 L , 12 R ), the differential being configured to mechanically transfer power across itself; and a mechanical power splitter (48 L ) having a first torque transfer feature (54 L ) in a torque connection with a combustion engine (35), a second torque transfer feature (50 L ) in a torque connection with a respective additional electric motor (52 L ) and a third torque transfer feature (49 L ) in a torque connection with at least one of the first and second torque outputs (14 L ) of the drive configuration, wherein torque output from the or each said mechanical power splitter (48, 48 R ) in use is dependent on torques generated by the combustion engine (35) and the associated additional electric motor (52 L ).
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column13: A differential (10) comprising: a left-side planetary gear set (12L) having a sun gear (16 L) configured to receive rotational drive input from a drive source (20), a ring gear (22 L) in a torque connection with an electric motor (26) and a carrier gear (14 L) configured to be operatively coupled with a left-side vehicle drive member (30 L) in a torque connection; a right-side planetary gear set (12 R) having a sun gear (16 R) configured to receive rotational drive input from the drive source (20), a ring gear (22 R) in a torque connection with the electric motor (26) and a carrier gear (14 R) configured to be operatively coupled with a right-side vehicle drive member (30 R) in a torque connection; wherein the sun gears (16L, 16 R) of the left and right side planetary gear sets (12 L,12 R) are rotationally fixed relative to each other and, in use, the amount of power transferred between the drive source (20) and each of the respective drive members (30 L, 30 R) can be selectively controlled by operating the electric motor (26) to drive or apply torque to the ring gears (22 L, 22 R) in opposite directions.

column13: 전기 모터는: 전자기 구동력이 상기 전기 모터의 사용시에 그 회전자에 공급되도록 하기 위한 원주 방향으로 분포된 복수의 구동 소자들을 포함하는 고정자로서, 각각의 구동 소자는 금속 코어 둘레에 연장하는 배선을 포함하여 코일들에 전류가 흐를 때 상기 금속 코어를 자화시키기 위한 복수의 코일들을 한정하고, 각각의 구동 소자의 금속 코어와 그 둘레의 코일들 사이에 적어도 하나의 공간이 존재하는, 상기 고정자; 및 상기 구동 소자들로부터 다른 데로 열을 전달하기 위한 냉각 수단을 포함하고; 각각의 상기 구동 소자는 또한, 상기 코일들로부터 상기 냉각 수단으로 열을 전달하기 위하여, 상기 금속 코어와 그 주위의 코일들 사이의 공간 또는 각각의 공간에 각각 위치된 복수의 상호 전기적으로 절연된 금속성 소자들을 포함하는 열 전도체를 포함한다.

column12: 스키드 조향 차량을 위한 구동 구성체
column13: 스키드 조향 차량용 구동 장치(10B)는 차동 장치(13)에 의해 결합되고 제 1 및 제 2 전기 모터(12, 12)와 토크 연결되는 제 1 및 제 2 토크 출력부(14, 14)로서, 자체적으로 동력을 기계적으로 전달하도록 구성된 상기 제 1 및 제 2 토크 출력부(14, 14); 및 연소 엔진(35)과 토크 연결되는 제 1 토크 전달 피처(54), 각각의 추가 전기 모터(52)와 토크 연결되는 제 2 토크 전달 피처(50) 및 상기 구동 구성체의 상기 제 1 및 제 2 토크 출력부(14) 중 적어도 하나와 토크 연결되는 제 3 토크 전달 피처(49)를 갖는 기계식 동력 스플릿터(48)를 포함하며, 사용 시에 상기 또는 각각의 상기 기계식 동력 스플릿터(48, 48)로부터의 토크 출력부는 상기 연소 엔진(35) 및 상기 관련 추가 전기 모터(52)에 의해 발생된 토크에 의존한다.

column12: AN ELECTRIC MOTOR
column13: An electric motor comprising: a stator comprising a plurality of circumferentially distributed drive elements for causing an electromagnetic driving force to be applied to a rotor of the electric motor in use, wherein each drive element comprises a wire extending around a metal core to define a plurality of coils for magnetizing the metal core when current flows in the coils, and wherein at least one space exists between the metal core of each respective drive element and the coils around it; and cooling means for transferring heat away from the drive elements; wherein each said drive element further comprises a heat conductor comprising a plurality of mutually electrically isolated metallic elements located in the or each respective space between the metal core thereof and the coils around it, for transferring heat from the coils to the cooling means.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: Configuraciones de accionamiento para vehículos con dirección deslizante
column13: Una configuración de accionamiento para un vehículo con dirección deslizante que comprende un miembro de accionamiento respectivo adaptado para estar ubicado en cada lado del vehículo, acoplándose cada miembro de accionamiento con una oruga o rueda del vehículo; al menos un motor (1a, 1b) de propulsión eléctrica en comunicación operable con dichos miembros de accionamiento que se pueden operar para accionar las orugas o ruedas del vehículo de dirección deslizante; al menos un motor (9a, 9b) de dirección en comunicación accionable con un diferencial (8) controlado colocado entre y conectando un par de árboles (7a, 7b) primarios y en comunicación accionable con cada árbol (7a, 7b) primario, formando los extremos de cada árbol (7a, 7b) primario alejado del diferencial (8) controlado una salida de la configuración de accionamiento y estando en comunicación accionable con los miembros de accionamiento; en donde el al menos un motor (1a, 1b) de propulsión eléctrica se proporciona en un árbol (20a, 20b) secundario alejado de los árboles (7a, 7b) primarios y la configuración de accionamiento comprende además al menos una unidad (2a, 2b) de cambio de engranajes asociada con el al menos un motor (1a, 1b) de propulsión eléctrica provisto lejos del árbol (7a, 7b) primario.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: Drive configurations for skid steered vehicles
column13: A drive configuration for a skid steered vehicle, comprising: first and second torque outputs that are coupled by a differential and in a torque connection with first and second electric motors respectively, wherein the differential is configured to mechanically transfer power across itself and comprises: a pair of outer planetary gear sets and a pair of inner planetary gear sets, both pairs disposed between the first and second electric motors, the pair of inner planetary gear sets being disposed between (i.e. nested within) the pair of outer planetary gear sets; the pair of outer planetary gear sets comprising: a pair of outer planet carriers arranged to turn with the respective output shafts; a pair of outer sun gears arranged to turn with the respective rotors of the propulsion motors; and, a pair of outer ring gears, operatively coupled to each other via a gear arrangement that only permits the outer ring gears to rotate relative to one another in an equal and opposite manner; the pair of inner planetary gear sets comprising: a pair of inner planet carriers interconnected by a cross-shaft such that the carriers rotate in common; a pair of inner ring gears arranged to turn with the respective output shafts; and, a pair of inner sun gears, wherein at least one sun gear is operatively coupled to the gear arrangement and, either the other inner sun gear is also operatively coupled to the gear arrangement so that the inner sun gears rotate relative to one another in an equal and opposite manner, or, the other inner sun gear is fixed stationary.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: FERNSEHPROGRAMMVERTEILSYSTEM
column13: A novel advanced set top terminal capable of digital decompression, menu generation, interactivity and other advanced functional capabilities for use in a television program delivery system (200) is described. The invention relates to methods and apparatus for upgrading existing set top terminals (220) to provide menu generation capability and advanced functional capabilities. The invention is particularly useful in television program delivery systems (200) with hundreds of channels of programming, providing (i) menu driven program selection through the addition of an upgrade module (300) or menu generation card and (ii) advanced functional capabilities using a set of hardware upgrades (e.g., 130) and/or an expansion card. Specifically, the invention is an upgradeable system that supports advanced set top functionality through the use of internal software, hardware upgrades, an upgrade module and/or expansion cards. The upgraded hardware generally includes a microprocessor, various input/output ports (e.g., 308), processing circuitry (e.g., 108) and memory (e.g., 116). The invention results in an upgraded set top terminal that supports: menu generation; picture-on-picture displays; program catalogue services; interactive services; telephone caller identification; digital audio reception; VCR control; HDTV reception; and backyard satellite system interoperability, among other features and capabilities.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN;;BONNER ALFRED

column12: Drive configuration
column13: A drive configuration for a skid-steered vehicle comprising: a pair of traction motors (102) for rotationally driving opposite outputs of the drive configuration, the traction motors being operatively connected to the outputs (113) via respective gearing arrangements (104) for selectively varying gear reduction between each of the traction motors and the corresponding output; a steer differential (110) in a torque connection with the first and second outputs of the drive configuration; and a steer motor (106) operatively connected to the steer differential for selectively varying the rotational speed of the first and second outputs in use; wherein the traction and steer motors define a volume in which the gearing arrangements and steering differential are at least partially located.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: APPARATUS FOR MANAGING FLUID FLOW IN A VEHICLE
column13: Apparatus for managing fluid flow in a vehicle, comprising: an epicylic gear set having first and second inputs configured to receive rotational drive input from a torque output feature of a powertrain and a rotary actuator respectively; a pump driver for driving a fluid pump, the pump driver configured to receive rotational drive input from an output of the epicylic gear set; and a controller configured to determine information corresponding to the rotational speed of the torque output feature using information generated by a rotational speed sensor and based on this control the rotary actuator such that the pump driver is caused to rotate at substantially a pre-specified speed.
column15: FLAXMAN ROBERT JOHN BONNER

column12: DRIVE CONFIGURATIONS FOR SKID STEERED VEHICLES
column13: A drive configuration for a skid steered vehicle comprising drive members (6A) which engage a track or wheel located at each side of the vehicle. At least one propulsion motor (1) is in operable communication with the drive members (6A), and at least one steer motor (9A) is in driveable communication with a controlled differential (8) positioned between, and connecting, a pair of primary shafts (7A). The ends of the primary shafts (7A) remote from the controlled differential (8) form an output of the transmission and are in driveable communication with the drive members (6A). The at least one propulsion motor (1) is provided on a secondary shaft (7A, 7B) remote from the primary shafts (7A).

column12: Television program delivery system
column13: A system for delivering digital program signals from a center to subscriber locations using a satellite with a first satellite transponder, the system comprising a center, remotely located from the subscriber locations, wherein more than one digital program signal is processed for transmission to a first satellite transponder, a first cable headend, comprising a first satellite dish, wherein the digital program signals are received from the first satellite transponder; and a means, connected to the first satellite dish, for sending the digital program signals from the first cable headend to the subscriber locations; and a first terminal, located at each subscriber location, wherein the sent digital program signals are received from the first cable headend and at least one digital program signal is processed for subscriber viewing.

column13: 차동 장치(10)는: 구동원(20)으로부터 회전 구동 입력을 수용하도록 구성된 태양 기어(16), 전기 모터(26)와 토크 연결되는 링 기어(22) 및 좌측 차량 구동 부재(30)와 토크 연결 상태로 작동 가능하게 결합되도록 구성된 캐리어 기어(14)를 갖는 좌측 유성 기어 세트(12); 및 상기 구동원(20)으로부터 회전 구동 입력을 수용하도록 구성된 태양 기어(16), 상기 전기 모터(26)와 토크 연결되는 링 기어(22) 및 우측 차량 구동 부재(30)와 토크 연결 상태로 작동 가능하게 결합되도록 구성된 캐리어 기어(14)를 갖는 우측 유성 기어 세트(12)를 포함하고, 상기 좌측 및 우측 유성 기어 세트(12, 12)의 태양 기어들(16, 16)은 서로에 대해 회전 고정되며, 사용시, 상기 구동원(20)과 상기 각각의 구동 부재(30, 30) 각각 사이에 전달되는 동력의 양은 반대 방향으로 상기 링 기어들(22, 22)에 토크를 구동하거나 또는 인가하기 위하여 상기 전기 모터(26)를 작동시킴으로써 선택적으로 제어될 수 있다.

column13: Una configuración de accionamiento que comprende: un par de motores de tracción (102; 202; 302) para accionar de manera giratoria la primera y la segunda salida (113; 213) opuestas de la configuración de accionamiento, los motores de tracción (102; 202; 302) que están conectados operativamente a las salidas (113; 213) mediante respectivas disposiciones de engranajes (104; 204) para variar selectivamente la reducción de engranajes entre cada uno de los motores de tracción (102; 202; 302) y la salida correspondiente (113; 213); un diferencial de dirección (110) en una conexión de par con la primera y la segunda salida (113; 213) de la configuración de accionamiento; y un motor de dirección (106; 206; 306) conectado operativamente al diferencial de dirección (110) para variar selectivamente la velocidad de rotación de la primera y la segunda salida (113; 213) en uso; caracterizado porque los motores de tracción y dirección (102; 202; 302; 106; 206; 306) definen un volumen en el que las respectivas disposiciones de engranajes (104; 204) y el diferencial de dirección (110) están ubicados al menos parcialmente.

column12: Óleo de base lubrificante
column13: óleo de base lubrificante. a presente invenção se refere a um óleo de base lubrificante, a formulações lubrificantes, a um método de lubrificação de um eixo de rotação dentro de um tubo de popa e ao uso de um óleo de base lubrificante. o óleo de base e as formulações lubrificantes podem ser particularmente adequados para uso em ambientes aquáticos (incluindo água doce ou água salgada). é fornecido, em particular, um óleo de base lubrificante que compreende um primeiro copolímero em bloco de (eo)(po)(eo) e um segundo copolímero em bloco de (eo)(po)(eo) que é diferente do primeiro copolímero em bloco de (eo)(po)(eo) em uma formulação lubrificante de uso marítimo, em que o óleo de base lubrificante tem uma densidade de pelo menos 1028 kg/m3 a 20 °c e de no máximo 1022 kg/m3 a 40 °c.
column15: KEVIN JOHN DUNCAN;;BONNER PAUL

column12: Lubricant base stock
column13: The present invention relates to a lubricant base stock, lubricant formulations, a method of lubricating a rotating shaft within a stern tube and the use of a lubricant base stock. The base stock and lubricant formulations may be particularly suited for use in aqueous environments (including fresh water or salt water). A lubricant base stock comprising a first (EO)(PO)(EO) block co-polymer and a second (EO)(PO)(EO) block co-polymer which is different from the first (EO)(PO)(EO) block co-polymer in a marine lubricant formulation wherein the lubricant base stock has a density of at least 1028 kg/m 3 at 20° C. and at most 1022 kg/m 3 at 40° C. in particular is provided.

column12: METHODS AND APPARATUS FOR IN-GAME ADVERTISING
column13: Methods and apparatus for an in-game advertising system may comprise a game that comprises one or more adaptable game environment elements and an advertising content system that is configured to store a plurality of advertising elements that can be inserted into the adaptable game environment elements during gameplay. The advertising content system may select which advertising element is inserted into a given adaptable game environment element based on criteria such as unique player information, a type of adaptable game environment element within the game itself, or a pre-defined content type.

column12: Pressure transmitter
column13: A pressure transmitter for sensing fluidic pressure to produce an indication that is converted into a signal for transmission to a remote station. The transmitter includes a sensor constituted by a diaphragm which seals a chamber in a meter body subject to fluid pressure, the diaphragm being axially dilated in accordance with the applied pressure. Anchored on the diaphragm is an upstanding force beam which is pushed thereby in the axial direction. A range spring which is offset with respect to the axis of the beam is connected between an intermediate point on the beam and the meter body. The spring acts to constrain axial motion of the beam, whereby when the diaphragm is dilated by fluidic pressure, the beam is caused to deflect to an extent determined thereby. A motion detector is operatively coupled to the upper end of the beam to convert the deflection thereof into a corresponding signal for transmission.
column15: KAZAHAYA MASAHIRO;;BONNER JOHN J

column12: LUBRICANT BASE STOCK
column13: The present invention relates to a lubricant base stock, lubricant formulations, a method of lubricating a rotating shaft within a stern tube and the use of a lubricant base stock. The base stock and lubricant formulations may be particularly suited for use in aqueous environments (including fresh water or salt water). A lubricant base stock comprising a first (EO)(PO)(EO) block co-polymer and a second (EO)(PO)(EO) block co-polymer which is different from the first (EO)(PO)(EO) block co-polymer in a marine lubricant formulation wherein the lubricant base stock has a density of at least 1028 kg/m 3 at 20° C. and at most 1022 kg/m 3 at 40° C. in particular is provided.

column12: A Device for Locking and Unlocking Railway Carriage Doors from the Guard Van.
column13: 11,006. Garland, J. W., and Bonner, W. Nov. 4. Fastenings operated mechanically from a distance.-Running longitudinally of a railway carriage is a squared shaft e, which is made circular beneath each door at f to form a pivot for a counterweighted or spring-controlled lever g. To this lever g is jointed a bevelled catch n, which engages a striking-plate c on the door, inclined at d to depress the catch readily when in operative position. The shaft e has a nose h, which, when the shaft is turned, engages a pin k on the lever g and withdraws the catch. The coupling between the carriages is shown in Fig. 2. The ends of the shafts e slide in squared recesses in spring buffers r, s, the buffer s having a squared projection t which engages a squared recess u in the buffer r.

column12: Bast stalk alignment feed and decortication system
column13: A plant stalk decortication apparatus and method are provided. The apparatus includes an alignment system in which a series of rotating spindles with blades attached to the spindles are positioned over a bed on which plant stalks are longitudinally aligned and conveyed by the blades. The apparatus also includes rollers and breakers downstream of the blades for crushing and breaking the plant stalks to cause the bast fibers and hurd to separate. The apparatus also includes a suction chamber that separates loose bast fiber from hurd chips formed by the breakers.
column15: LUPIEN JOHN C;;BONNER JONATHAN

column12: Vehicle wheel having monitoring device and monitoring device for vehicle wheel
column13: The invention relates to a vehicle wheel having a monitoring device, the monitoring device 10 comprising a housing 11 rotatably arranged on a rim part 2 of the vehicle wheel, and an electronic circuit 20 arranged in the housing 11 and coupled to a load detection device arranged in the housing and having a strain gauge, a strain gauge is used to detect a force acting on a wheel of a vehicle. In order to create a monitoring device which can be easily mounted on different vehicle wheels and which can reliably determine the load forces occurring on the vehicle wheels, the housing 11 has two fastening regions 12, 13 which are spaced apart from each other and which are connected to each other via at least one curved strut, at least one bending column is connected to the two fastening areas as a part of the load detection device, and at least one pair of strain gauges is arranged on the bending column between the fastening areas and is used for detecting bending of the bending column caused by the load force.

column12: Menu-driven television program access system and method
column13: A novel advanced set top terminal capable of digital decompression, menu generation, interactivity and other advanced functional capabilities for use in a television program delivery system (200) is described. The invention relates to methods and apparatus for upgrading existing set top terminals (220) to provide menu generation capability and advanced functional capabilities. The invention is particularly useful in television program delivery systems (200) with hundreds of channels of programming, providing (i) menu driven program selection through the addition of an upgrade module (300) or menu generation card and (ii) advanced functional capabilities using a set of hardware upgrades (e.g., 130) and/or an expansion card. Specifically, the invention is an upgradeable system that supports advanced set top functionality through the use of internal software, hardware upgrades, an upgrade module and/or expansion cards. The upgraded hardware generally includes a microprocessor, various input/output ports (e.g., 308), processing circuitry (e.g., 108) and memory (e.g., 116). The invention results in an upgraded set top terminal that supports: menu generation; picture-on-picture displays; program catalogue services; interactive services; telephone caller identification; digital audio reception; VCR control; HDTV reception; and backyard satellite system interoperability, among other features and capabilities.

column12: Apparatus and method for packaging programs in a television program delivery system
column13: An apparatus and a method provide optimum packaging of programs for delivery over a television program delivery system. The apparatus includes a central processor unit (CPU) that is used to select program categories and identify external and internal programs. For packaging. The CPU includes advanced features to weight programs according to established criteria including previous buying history, programs watched data, and viewer demographics. The CPU formats a menu having a program lineup and assigns transponder space. Other advanced features include the use of multiple operations centers to support the packaging, delivery of the packaged programs to cable television headends, insertion of local avails, and direct transmission of program packages to individual television terminals.

column12: NETWORK CONTROLLER FOR CABLE TELEVISION DELIVERY SYSTEMS
column13: A novel network controller (214) for use with a digital cable headend (208) capable of monitoring and controlling set top terminals (220) in a television program delivery system (200) is described. The invention relates to methods and apparatus for a network controller (214) that manages a configuration of set top terminals (220) in a program delivery system (200). The invention is particularly useful in program delivery systems (200) with hundreds of channels of programming, a menu driven program selection system, and a program control information signal that carries data and identifies available program choices. Specifically, the invention modifies a program control information signal at the cable headend (208) before the modified signal is transmitted to each set top terminal (220). This signal is used with polling methods to receive upstream data from the set top terminals (220). The invention initiates such upstream data retrieval, gathers all data received and compiles viewer demographics information and programs watched information. The invention processes this data and information to generate packages of advertisements, as well as account and billing reports, targeted towards each set top terminal (220). The invention uses upstream data reception hardware, databases and processing hardware and software to accomplish these functions.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: VERFAHREN ZUM KOMPAKTIEREN VON OLEFINFASERN
column13: A polyolefin plaque is produced by hot compaction of an assembly of melt spun oriented fibres. It has been found that good compaction can be achieved at relatively low compaction pressures, less than 10 Pa. Compaction can be carried out in an autoclave, rather than in a hot compaction press, and the mechanical properties of plaques so produced range from good to excellent.

column12: NETWORK CONTROLLER FOR CABLE TELEVISION DELIVERY SYSTEM
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a network controller for cable television delivery systems with respect to a television entertainment system for providing television programs to consumers' homes.

SOLUTION: The network controller (214) remotely manages account and billing information on a cable television distribution network (236) configuring the cable television delivery system and provides monitoring and control to set top terminals in the system. The network controller is a key element to the digital cable television delivery system. The network controller has more excellent capability and flexibility in comparison with those of an existing cable headend controller.

column12: Method and apparatus for gathering programs watched data
column13: A processor in a television program delivery system receives programs watched information from terminals in a television delivery system. The processor arranges the programs watched information in a database or programs watched matrix so that the frequency of programs watched may be determined. The programs watched matrix may consist of time slots and program categories. The processor determines a program count for programs or program categories. The program count may then be used to send programming to the terminals. The terminals may provide the programs watched information in response to a cyclic polling message generated by the processor or by using a random access routine. The programs watched information may be provided over a cable or a telephone line.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: Method and apparatus for switching targeted advertisements at a set top terminal
column13: A system and method for switching targeted advertisements is described. In one embodiment one primary advertisement is assigned to a first channel, where the first channel carries a program. At least one alternate advertisement is assigned to one or more alternate channels. Selected set top terminals switch to one or more of the alternate channels to display alternate advertisements, where the selection of the alternate channel is based on information related to users of the set top terminals.

column12: TELEVISION PROGRAM DELIVERY SYSTEM
column13: An expanded television program delivery system is described which allows viewers to select television and audio program choices from a series of menus. The primary components of the system include an operations center, a digital cable headend, and at least one set top terminal having a remote control. The system allows for a great number of television signals to be transmitted by using digital compression techniques. A combined signal is transmitted over satellite to a cable headend, which may modify the combined signal for changes or additions in programming or menu content. The combined or modified signal is subsequently distributed to individual set top terminals in the cable network. Menus are partially stored in a set top terminal in each subscriber's home and may be reprogrammed by signals sent from the operations center or headend. Numerous types of menus may be used, incorporating information included within the video/data signal received by the set top terminal. A remote control unit with icon buttons allows a subscriber to select programs based upon a series of major menus, submenus, and during program menus. Various data gathering and analysis techniques are used to compile programs watched information that in turn is used in packaging programs, customizing menu selections, targeting advertisements, and maintaining account and billing information.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: OPERATION CENTER FOR TELEVISION PROGRAM PACKAGING AND DELIVERY SYSTEM
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a program providing method in a television delivery system with respect to a television entertainment system for providing television programs to consumers' homes.

SOLUTION: The method for program packaging includes the steps of a program delivery center for packaging programs into one package so that the package includes at least one program; generating menu information related to the program package; using a television delivery system (200) to provide the menu information to terminals; storing the menu information to the terminals (220); and displaying the menu information as a program menu. Further, the program menu is displayed on a first part of a display apparatus coupled to the terminal and the program menu is displayed by using a television channel.

column12: TELEVISION PROGRAM DELIVERY SYSTEM
column13: An expanded television program delivery system (200) is described which allows viewers to select televison and audio program choices from a series of menus. The primary components of the system include an operations center (202), a digital cable headend (208), and at least one set top terminal (220) having a remote control (900). The system allows for a great number of television signals to be transmitted by using digital compression techniques. A combined signal is transmitted over satellite to a cable headend (208), which may modify the combined signal for changes or additions in programming or menu content. The combined or modified signal is subsequently distributed to individual set top terminals (220) in the cable network (210). Menus are partially stored in a set top terminal (220) in each subscriber's home and may be reprogrammed by signals sent from the operations center (202) or headned (208). Numerous types of menus may be used, incorporating information included within the video/data signal received by the set top terminal (220). A remote control unit (900) with icon buttons allows a subscriber to select programs based upon a series of major menus, submenus, and during program menus. Various data gathering and analysis techniques are used to compile programs watched information that in turn is used in packaging programs, customizing menu selections, targeting advertisements, and maintaining account and billing information.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: Flow meter
column13: A flow meter comprising a metallic conduit (1) through which, in use, fluid flow takes place, and ultrasonic transducer (4) mounted in a wall of the conduit (1) and operable to sense the presence of fluid in the conduit, the transducer being mounted in the conduit wall in metallic mounting (6) which are sealed in said wall by welding (9).
column15: BONNER TIMOTHY;;CURTHOYS JOHN R C
column16: SCHEME ENGINEERING LTD. A CORP. OF ENGLAND (1989-01-26)

column12: NETWORK CONTROLLER FOR CABLE TELEVISION DELIVERY SYSTEMS
column13: A novel network controller (214) for use with a digital cable headend (208) capable of monitoring and controlling set top terminals (220) in a television program delivery system (200) is described. The invention elates to methods and apparatus for a network controller (214) that manages a configuration of set top terminals (220) in a program delivery system (200). The invention is particularly useful in program delivery systems (200) with hundreds of channels of programming, a menu driven program selection system, and a program control information signal that carries data and identifies available program choices. Specifically, the invention modifies a program control information signal at the cable headend (208) before the modified signal is transmitted to each set top terminal (220). This signal is used with polling methods to receive upstream data from the set top terminals (220). The invention initiates such upstream data retrieval, gathers all data received and compiles viewer demographics information and programs watched information. The invention processes this data and information to generate packages of advertisements, as well as account and billing reports, targeted towards each set top terminal (220). The invention uses upstream data reception hardware, databases and processing hardware and software to accomplish these functions.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: Liquid presence sensors.
column13: A liquid presence sensor comprises a body (1) having a bore (2) extending therethrough, ultrasonic transducer means (4) mounted on the body and arranged, in use, to sense the presence of liquid in the bore, and mounting means (14, 15) for mounting the sensor in line with a conduit (12, 13) for containing liquid the presence of which is to be sensed, whereby the bore in the sensor body is substantially coaxial with the conduit.
column15: CURTHOYS JOHN ROBERT CHARLES;;BONNER TIMOTHY

column12: Operationszentrale für Fernsehversorgungssystem
column13: A novel advanced set top terminal capable of digital decompression, menu generation, interactivity and other advanced functional capabilities for use in a television program delivery system (200) is described. The invention relates to methods and apparatus for upgrading existing set top terminals (220) to provide menu generation capability and advanced functional capabilities. The invention is particularly useful in television program delivery systems (200) with hundreds of channels of programming, providing (i) menu driven program selection through the addition of an upgrade module (300) or menu generation card and (ii) advanced functional capabilities using a set of hardware upgrades (e.g., 130) and/or an expansion card. Specifically, the invention is an upgradeable system that supports advanced set top functionality through the use of internal software, hardware upgrades, an upgrade module and/or expansion cards. The upgraded hardware generally includes a microprocessor, various input/output ports (e.g., 308), processing circuitry (e.g., 108) and memory (e.g., 116). The invention results in an upgraded set top terminal that supports: menu generation; picture-on-picture displays; program catalogue services; interactive services; telephone caller identification; digital audio reception; VCR control; HDTV reception; and backyard satellite system interoperability, among other features and capabilities.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: AN OPERATION CENTER FOR A TELEVISION PROGRAM PACKAGING AND DELIVERY SYSTEM
column13: An Operations Center (202) for television entertainment systems that provide television programming to consumer homes is disclosed. The Operations Center (202) organizes and packages television programming and program information for delivery to and from consumer homes. The Operations Center (202) includes a computerized packaging system (260) for creating a program control information signal.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: Menu-driven television program access system and method
column13: In a method for providing programming in a television delivery system, the programming is packaged at a television delivery center, wherein the package includes at least one program, and menu information related to the programming packaging is generated. The menu information is provided to terminals and stored therein the terminals. The menu information is displayed as programming menus, wherein a programming menu is displayed on a first portion of a display coupled to a terminal. When a program is chosen from the displayed programming menu, a program selection based on the program chosen is received from the displayed programming menu. The terminal is switched to a television channel carrying the chosen program, wherein the switching is completed in response to a single control function, and the chosen program is displayed on the display.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: Method and apparatus for switching targeted advertisements at a set top terminal
column13: A system and method for switching targeted advertisements is described. In one embodiment one primary advertisement is assigned to a first channel, where the first channel carries a program. At least one alternate advertisement is assigned to one or more alternate channels. Selected set top terminals switch to one or more of the alternate channels to display alternate advertisements, where the selection of the alternate channel is based on information related to users of the set top terminals.

column12: AN OPERATION CENTER FOR A TELEVISION PROGRAM PACKAGING AND DELIVERY SYSTEM
column13: A menu-driven television program access system and method provide a menu structure that allows subscribers to select and view television programming and other services. The menu structure lists programs by program category or by chronological order of broadcast. The subscriber scrolls the menus until a desired program identifier, such as a title and date/time of broadcast is found. The subscriber then operates a "go-button" on a remote control to select the desired program. In response to operation of the "go-button", a set top terminal turns to a channel carrying the selected program.

column12: VERFAHREN ZUM KOMPAKTIEREN VON OLEFINFASERN
column13: A polyolefin plaque is produced by hot compaction of an assembly of melt spun oriented fibres. It has been found that good compaction can be achieved at relatively low compaction pressures, less than 10 Pa. Compaction can be carried out in an autoclave, rather than in a hot compaction press, and the mechanical properties of plaques so produced range from good to excellent.

column12: NETWORK CONTROLLER FOR CABLE TELEVISION DELIVERY SYSTEMS
column13: A NOVEL NETWORK CONTROLLER FOR USE WITH A DIGITAL CABLE HEADEND CAPABLE OF MONITORING AND CONTROLLING SET TOP TERMINALS IN A TELEVISION PROGRAM DELIVERY SYSTEM IS DESCRIBED. THE INVENTION RELATES TO METHODS AND APPARATUS FOR A NETWORK CONTROLLER THAT MANAGING A CONFIGURATION OF SET TOP TERMINALS IN A PROGRAM DELIVERY SYSTEM. THE INVENTION IS PARTICULARLY USEFUL IN PROGRAM DELIVERY SYSTEMS WITH HUNDREDS OF CHANNELS OF PROGRAMMING, A MENU DRIVEN PROGRAM SELECTION SYSTEM, AND A PROGRAM CONTROL INFORMATION SIGNAL THAT CARRIES DATA AND IDENTIFIES AVAILABLE PROGRAM CHOICES. SPECIFICALLY, THE INVENTION MODIFIES A PROGRAM CONTROL INFORMATION SIGNAL AT THE CABLE HEADEND BEFORE THE MODIFIED SIGNAL IS TRANSMITTED TO EACH SET TOP TERMINAL. THIS SIGNAL IS USED WITH POLLING METHODS TO RECEIVE UPSTREAM DATA FROM THE SET TOP TERMINALS. THE INVENTION INITIATES SUCH UPSTREAM DATA RETRIEVAL, GATHERS ALL DATA RECEIVED AND COMPILES VIEWER DEMOGRAPHICS INFORMATION AND PROGRAMS WATCHED INFORMATION. THE INVENTION PROCESSES THIS DATA AND INFORMATION TO GENERATE PACKAGES OF ADVERTISEMENTS, AS WELL AS ACCOUNT AND BILLING REPORTS, TARGETED TOWARDS EACH SET TOP TERMINAL. THE INVENTION USES UPSTREAM DATA RECEPTION HARDWARE, DATABASE AND PROCESSING HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE TO ACCOMPLISH THESE FUNCTIONS. (FIGURE 5)
column15: JOHN S HENDRICKS;;ALFRED E BONNER

THE SAID OPERATIOPNS CENTER ( 202 ) ORGANIZES AND PACKAGES TELEVISION PROGRAMMING AND PROGRAM INFORMATION FOR DELIVERY TO AND FROM CIONSUMER HOMES. THE SAID OPERATIONS CENTER ( 202 ) INCLUDES A COMPUTERIZED PACKAGING SYSTEM ( 260 ) FOR CREATING A PROGRAM CONTROL INFORMATION SIGNAL. ( FIGURE 5 ).
column15: ALFRED E BONNER;;JOHN S HENDRICKS

column12: NETWORK CONTROLLER FOR CABLE TELEVISION DELIVERY SYSTEMS
column13: A novel network controller (214) for use with a digital cable headend (208) capable of monitoring and controlling set top terminals (220) in a television program delivery system (200) is described The invention relates to methods and apparatus for a network controller (214) that manages a configuration of set top terminals (220) in a program delivery system (200). The invention is particularly useful in program delivery systems (200) with hundreds of channels of programming, a menu driven program selection system, and a program control information signal that carries data and identifies available program choices. Specifically, the invention modifies a program control information signal at the cable headend (208) before the modified signal is transmitted to each set top terminal (220). This signal is used with polling methods to receive upstream data from the set top terminals (220). The invention initiates such upstream data retrieval, gathers all data received and compiles viewer demographics information and programs watched information. The invention processes this data and information to generate packages of advertisements, as well as account and billing reports, targeted towards each set top terminal (220). The invention uses upstream data reception hardware, databases and processing hardware and software to accomplish these functions.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: VERFAHREN UND GERÄT ZUR ERFASSUNG VON PROGRAMMEINSCHALTDATEN
column13: A novel advanced set top terminal capable of digital decompression, menu generation, interactivity and other advanced functional capabilities for use in a television program delivery system (200) is described. The invention relates to methods and apparatus for upgrading existing set top terminals (220) to provide menu generation capability and advanced functional capabilities. The invention is particularly useful in television program delivery systems (200) with hundreds of channels of programming, providing (i) menu driven program selection through the addition of an upgrade module (300) or menu generation card and (ii) advanced functional capabilities using a set of hardware upgrades (e.g., 130) and/or an expansion card. Specifically, the invention is an upgradeable system that supports advanced set top functionality through the use of internal software, hardware upgrades, an upgrade module and/or expansion cards. The upgraded hardware generally includes a microprocessor, various input/output ports (e.g., 308), processing circuitry (e.g., 108) and memory (e.g., 116). The invention results in an upgraded set top terminal that supports: menu generation; picture-on-picture displays; program catalogue services; interactive services; telephone caller identification; digital audio reception; VCR control; HDTV reception; and backyard satellite system interoperability, among other features and capabilities.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: TELEVISION PROGRAM DELIVERY SYSTEM
column13: An expanded television program delivery system is described which allows viewers to select television and audio program choices from a series of menus. The primary components of the system include an operations center, a digital cable headend, and at least one set top terminal having a remote control. The system allows for a great number of television signals to be transmitted by using digital compression techniques. A combined signal is transmitted over satellite to a cable headend, which may modify the combined signal for changes or additions in programming or menu content. The combined or modified signal is subsequently distributed to individual set top terminals in the cable network. Menus are partially stored in a set top terminal in each subscriber's home and may be reprogrammed by signals sent from the operations center or headend. Numerous types of menus may be used, incorporating information included within the video/data signal received by the set top terminal. A remote control unit with icon buttons allows a subscriber to select programs based upon a series of major menus, submenus, and during program menus. Various data gathering and analysis techniques are used to compile programs watched information that in turn is used in packaging programs, customizing menu selections, targeting advertisements, and maintaining account and billing information.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: Menu-driven television program access system and method
column13: In a method for providing programming in a television delivery system, the programming is packaged at a television delivery center, wherein the package includes at least one program, and menu information related to the programming packaging is generated. The menu information is provided to terminals and stored therein the terminals. The menu information is displayed as programming menus, wherein a programming menu is displayed on a first portion of a display coupled to a terminal. When a program is chosen from the displayed programming menu, a program selection based on the program chosen is received from the displayed programming menu. The terminal is switched to a television channel carrying the chosen program, wherein the switching is completed in response to a single control function, and the chosen program is displayed on the display.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: Menu-driven television program access system and method
column13: A menu-driven television program access system and method provide a menu structure that allows subscribers to select and view television programming and other services. The menu structure lists programs by program category or by chronological order of broadcast. The subscriber scrolls the menus until a desired program identifier, such as a title and date/time of broadcast is found. The subscriber then operates a “go-button” on a remote control to select the desired program. In response to operation of the “go-button,” a set top terminal turns to a channel carrying the selected program.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: Capacitive pressure transducer
column13: A capacitive pressure transducer constituted by a pressure sensor whose capacitance is caused to vary as a function of an applied pressure and a coupling assembly adapted to hydraulically convey the variable pressure of the fluid to be metered to the pressure sensor while isolating the structure of the sensor from the fluid. The sensor is formed by a cylinder, one end of which is enclosed by a deformable diaphragm that serves as one plate of a capacitor, deformation of the diaphragm in response to pressure acting to vary the dielectric spacing between the diaphragm plate and a second plate to produce a corresponding change in the value of the capacitance. The coupling assembly includes a body component having a column section and a base section, the column section being received within the cylinder of the sensor with its head spaced from the diaphragm to define therewith a sensor chamber which communicates through a passage in the column section with an isolation chamber formed at the bottom of the base section and sealed by a barrier diaphragm. The chambers and the passage are filled with hydraulic fluid whereby pressure applied to the barrier diaphragm by the fluid to be metered is transmitted to the sensor diaphragm.
column15: BONNER JOHN J;;CLAYTON C WILLIAM

column12: Targeted advertising in a cable television system
column13: An apparatus that maintains a viewer profile database for network controllers includes a receiver for receiving programs watched data, a first database to store viewer profiles which contain categories including program categories, wherein programs watched data is stored, a processor, operably connected to the receiver to update the viewer profiles with the received programs watched data, and a second database to store advertisements, wherein advertising categories are used to group related advertisements together. The apparatus correlates the viewer profiles with the second database and selects advertisements using the correlation.

column12: Method and apparatus for gathering program watched data

column12: Operations center for a television program packaging and delivery system
column13: An apparatus and a method provide optimum packaging of programs for delivery over a television program delivery system. The apparatus includes a central processor unit (CPU) that is used to select program categories and identify external and internal programs. For packaging. The CPU includes advanced features to weight programs according to established criteria including previous buying history, programs watched data, and viewer demographics. The CPU formats a menu having a program lineup and assigns transponder space. Other advanced features include the use of multiple operations centers to support the packaging, delivery of the packaged programs to cable television headends, insertion of local avails, and direct transmission of program packages to individual television terminals.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: NETWORK CONTROLLER FOR CABLE TELEVISION DELIVERY SYSTEMS
column13: A novel network controller for use with a digital cable headend capable of monitoring and controlling set top terminals in a television program delivery system is described. The invention relates to methods and apparatus for a network controller that manages a configuration of set top terminals in a program delivery system. The invention is particularly useful in program delivery systems with hundreds of channels of programming, a menu driven program selection system, and a program control information signal that carries data and identifies available program choices. Specifically, the invention modifies a program control information signal at the cable headend before the modified signal is transmitted to each set top terminal. This signal is used with polling methods to receive upstream data from the set top terminals. The invention initiates such upstream data retrieval, gathers all data received and compiles viewer demographics information and programs watched information. The invention processes this data and information to generate packages of advertisements, as well as account and billing reports, targeted towards each set top terminal. The invention uses upstream data reception hardware, databases and processing hardware and software to accomplish these functions.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: Bandwidth allocation for a television program delivery system
column13: This invention is a method of allocating bandwidth for a television program delivery system. This method selects specific programs from a plurality of programs, allocates the selected programs to a segment of bandwidth, and continues to allocate the programs until all the programs are allocated or all of the available bandwidth is allocated. The programs may be selected based on a variety of different factors or combination of factors. The selected programs may also be prioritized so that higher priority programs are distributed before lower priority programs in case there is not enough bandwidth to transmit all of the programs. This invention allows a television program delivery system to prioritize a large number of television programs and distribute these programs based on their priority levels. The invention also permits a television program delivery system to dynamically allocate bandwidth over time or based on marketing information, such as consumer demand.
column15: HENDRICKS JOHN S;;BONNER ALFRED E

column12: Floating gang rotary slitting device.
column13: The apparatus includes a first arbor shaft (20) for mounting and rotatably driving a first rotary cutter. The first cutter is comprised of at least one rotary knife element (30) having two opposite side faces, (34, 35) and the first arbor shaft (20) is constructed to allow axially movement of the knife element (30) along the first arbor shaft (20). A second arbor shaft (22) mounts and rotatably drives a second rotary cutter (14). The second rotary cutter (14) is comprised of at least one rotary knife element (28) which has two opposite side faces (32) and is movable axially along the second arbor shaft (22). The second arbor shaft (22) is also selectively movable radially with respect to the first arbor shaft (20) to provide a selected intermeshing overlap region (40) between the first cutter knife element (30) and the second cutter knife element (28). A resilient force means (42) resiliently urges the first cutter knife element (30) axially along the first arbor shaft (20) to contact the second cutter knife (28), thereby providing a selected contact pressure and a substantially zero clearance between each pair of intermeshing faces of the first (30) and second cutter knife elements (28) at the overlap region.

column13: A novel advanced set top terminal capable of digital decompression, menu generation, interactivity and other advanced functional capabilities for use in a television program delivery system (200) is described. The invention relates to methods and apparatus for upgrading existing set top terminals (220) to provide menu generation capability and advanced functional capabilities. The invention is particularly useful in television program delivery systems (200) with hundreds of channels of programming, providing (i) menu driven program selection through the addition of an upgrade module (300) or menu generation card and (ii) advanced functional capabilities using a set of hardware upgrades (e.g., 130) and/or an expansion card. Specifically, the invention is an upgradeable system that supports advanced set top functionality through the use of internal software, hardware upgrades, an upgrade module and/or expansion cards. The upgraded hardware generally includes a microprocessor, various input/output ports (e.g., 308), processing circuitry (e.g., 108) and memory (e.g., 116). The invention results in an upgraded set top terminal that supports: menu generation; picture-on-picture displays; program catalogue services; interactive services; telephone caller identification; digital audio reception; VCR control; HDTV reception; and backyard satellite system interoperability, among other features and capabilities.
