column12: Método para el suministro de un gas comprimido
column13: Método para el suministro de un gas comprimido, comprendiendo el método: (a) transferir el gas comprimido a una primera serie de depósitos de recepción en una primera serie de eventos detransferencia de fluido en los que cada uno de la primera serie de depósitos de recepción reciben el gas comprimidode un primer dispositivo móvil de almacenamiento de gas comprimido que comprende una primera serie dedepósitos de almacenamiento de gas comprimido, conectados por medio de un colector, y posteriormente reciben elgas comprimido de un segundo dispositivo móvil de almacenamiento de gas comprimido que comprende unasegunda serie de depósitos de almacenamiento de gas comprimido, conectados por medio de un colector, en cadaevento de transferencia de fluido de la serie de eventos de transferencia de fluido vaciando de este modo el primerdispositivo móvil de almacenamiento de gas comprimido y el segundo dispositivo móvil de almacenamiento de gascomprimido; (b) transportar el primer dispositivo móvil de almacenamiento de gas comprimido a una estación de rellenado unavez que el primer dispositivo móvil de almacenamiento de gas comprimido ha sido vaciado hasta un nivel de vaciadoseleccionado; column12: conjunto de dispositivo de influxo autônomo, e, método de controle de fluxo de furo de poço
column13: conjunto de dispositivo de influxo autônomo, e, método. são divulgados dispositivos de controle de fluxo de furo de poço que permitem ajustes de campo no local para as características do fluxo. um conjunto de dispositivo de controle de influxo autônomo (aicd) inclui uma tubulação de base que define uma ou mais portas de fluxo e um interior, um primeiro anel de extremidade e um segundo anel de extremidade, cada um disposto sobre a tubulação de base, o segundo anel de extremidade estando axialmente deslocado do primeiro anel de extremidade, tal que um compartimento de fluido seja definido entre os mesmos, um aicd disposto dentro do compartimento de fluido e com pelo menos uma entrada e uma saída de fluido configuradas para estar em comunicação fluida com uma da uma ou mais portas de fluxo, e um anel de fluxo disposto sobre a tubulação de base e em comunicação fluida com o aicd, o anel de fluxo sendo operável para regular um fluxo de fluido para o interior da tubulação de base e sendo acessível e manipulável por um operador do poço no local.
column15: AARON BONNER;;DAVID ALEXANDER SMART;;JEAN MARC LOPEZ;;JOHN BENJAMIN COX;;WILLIAM RYAN HUFFER

column12: FLOW RINGS FOR REGULATING FLOW IN AUTONOMOUS INFLOW CONTROL DEVICE ASSEMBLIES
column13: Disclosed are wellbore flow control devices that allow on-site field adjustments to flow characteristics. One autonomous inflow control device (AICD) assembly includes a base pipe defining one or more flow ports and an interior, a first end ring and a second end ring each arranged about the base pipe, the second end ring being axially-offset from the first end ring such that a fluid compartment is defined therebetween, an AICD arranged within the fluid compartment and having at least one fluid inlet and an outlet configured to be in fluid communication with one of the one or more flow ports, and a flow ring arranged about the base pipe and in fluid communication with the AICD, the flow ring being operable to regulate a fluid flow into the interior of the base pipe and being accessible and manipulatable by a well operator on-site.
column15: SMART DAVID ALEXANDER;;HUFFER WILLIAM RYAN;;BONNER AARON;;LOPEZ JEAN MARC;;COX JOHN BENJAMIN

column12: Methods of generator rotor removal in a combined-cycle stag application
column13: Support feet of a generator are mounted on foundation columns spaced laterally one from the other, with one column having a block in a recess for receiving the feet on one side of the generator. Guides on a radius and supported by the generator foundation extend through notches on the underside of the block. To locate an end of the generator displaced horizontally from the turbines, the generator is unloaded from the foundation and the block is removed. The generator is then loaded onto the guides and pivoted about a vertical axis to locate at least one end out of alignment with the axis of the turbines enabling removal of the generator rotor in an axial direction. By employing two blocks set in recesses in the opposite columns and sets of tracks which extend into the notches, the generator can be rotated about a vertical axis through its center to locate the generator rotor in axially non-interfering positions with the adjacent turbines.
column15: ASHAR SIDDHARTH N;;BONNER THOMAS;;BRADT RICHARD A;;WAGNER THOMAS A;;YAGIELSKI JOHN R

column12: COMPRESSED GAS DISPENSING METHOD
column13: A method for dispensing a compressed gas for reducing the amount of residual gas in dispensing station storage vessels before refilling is required. The method comprises transferring compressed gas into receiving vessels in a first series of fill- ups where each of the receiving vessels receive compressed gas from a first mobile storage device and subsequently from a second mobile storage device, transporting the first mobile storage device to a refilling station after the first mobile storage device has been depleted to a selected depletion level, refilling the first mobile storage device at the refilling station, and transferring compressed gas into receiving vessels in a second series of fill- ups where each of the receiving vessels receive compressed gas from the second mobile storage device and one or more of the first mobile storage device after refilling and a third mobile storage device.
column15: BONNER BRIAN BERNARD;;COHEN JOSEPH PERRY;;FARESE DAVID JOHN;;HEYDORN EDWARD CLYDE;;SUBRAMANIAN RAVI

column12: KONVEXES KLEBEFILMSYSTEM FÜR LASERANHEFTUNGS- MIKRODISSEKTIONSANALYSE
column13: A tissue sample is conventionally visualized in a microscope. A selectively activated convex surface is provided, preferably at the distal end of a rod. This selectively activated convex surface when activated, typically with a laser through an optic light path in the microscope, provides the activated region with adhesive properties. At least one portion of the tissue sample which is to be extracted is identified. This identified portion is contacted with a portion of the selectively activated convex surface on the end of the rod. When the convex surface is activated, typically by exposure to laser light in the footprint of the desired sample, an adhesive transfer surface on the selectively activated convex surface is provided which adheres to the desired cells in the footprint of the desired sample. Thereafter, the adhesive transfer surface is separated from the remainder of the tissue sample while maintaining adhesion with the desired cells. Thus the desired portion of the tissue sample is extracted. The disclosed selectively activated convex surface is preferably utilized to collect desired tissue samples at more than one location on the same slide or from different slides. The collected tissue samples can thereafter be inspected if desired, as collected on the convex surface, and then liberated-as by dissolving the proteins of the samples. This can effectively concentrate rarely occurring cells in order to obtain enough pure material for analysis. A rod having a convex surface with the selectively activated material is set forth as a staple for use with the apparatus and process. Preferred shapes for the convex surface are disclosed as well as a method for coating rods with a resultant rod article.

column12: REAL TIME LOCATION TRACKING SYSTEM OF STORE SHOPPERS USING A COMMUNICATION MULTI-NETWORK
column13: The invention relates to one or more systems for locating a shopper's, associate's, manager's or vendor's presumed position in a store using a communication multi-network for communication in the store. Specifically, at least one location device is positioned in proximity to, for example, a shopper such that the shopper's presumed position about the store may be known con-tinuously or upon demand to the store.

column12: EXTRAVASCULAR ARRHYTHMIA INDUCTION
column13: A cardiac arrhythmia may be induced by delivering a sequence of pulses to a patient via one or more extravascular electrodes. In one example, one or more pacing pulses may be delivered to a patient via an extravascular electrode and a shock pulse may be delivered to the patient the extravascular electrode. In some examples, the pacing pulses and the shock pulse may be generated with energy from a common energy storage module and without interim charging of the module. For example, the pacing and shock pulses may be generated as the energy storage module dissipates. In another example, a cardiac arrhythmia may be induced in a patient by delivering a burst of pulses to a patient via an extravascular electrode. In some cases, the burst of pulses may be generated with energy from a common energy storage module and without interim charging of the energy storage module.
column15: BONNER MATTHEW DAVID;;KUEHN KEVIN PATRICK;;NIKOLSKI VLADIMIR PAVLOVICH;;SULLIVAN JOSEPH L;;HAVEL WILLIAM JOHN

column12: Método de seguimiento de la ubicación en tiempo real de individuos a través de una multired en una tienda
column13: Un método para ubicar la ubicación presunta de un operador en una tienda (5), que comprende: a. hacer seguimiento a una presunta posición de dicho operador en dicha tienda (5) por al menos un dispositivo de seguimiento de ubicación mantenido en una posición próxima a dicho operador, dicho dispositivo de seguimiento de ubicación operando a través de una multired (10) de comunicación para proporcionar una función de seguimiento de ubicación para determinar los datos de ubicación de dicho operador en dicha tienda (5), en donde dicha multired (10) de comunicación comprende: i. al menos una red (16) de comunicación de estrella que está configurada para transferir datos de información que no son de ubicación que consisten en uno o más de datos de voz, datos de imagen, datos de video y/o transacciones financieras de al menos un motor lógico (23) a dicho al menos un dispositivo de seguimiento de ubicación, y ii. al menos una red (14) de comunicación de malla que está configurada para hacer seguimiento a dicho al menos un dispositivo de seguimiento de ubicación en dicha tienda (5) en base a dichos datos de ubicación; b. transmitir por dicho al menos un dispositivo de seguimiento de ubicación dichos datos de ubicación a través de dicha red (14) de comunicación de malla de dicha multired (10) de comunicación a dicho al menos un motor (23) lógico; y c. calcular mediante dicho al menos un motor (23) lógico una posición calculada de dicho al menos un dispositivo de seguimiento de ubicación en dicha tienda (5) basándose en dichos datos de ubicación.

column12: REAL TIME LOCATION TRACKING SYSTEM OF STORE SHOPPERS USING A COMMUNICATION MULTI-NETWORK
column13: The invention relates to one or more systems for locating a shopper's, associate's, manager's or vendor's presumed position in a store using a communication multi-network for communication in the store. Specifically, at least one location device is positioned in proximity to, for example, a shopper such that the shopper's presumed position about the store may be known continuously or upon demand to the store.

column12: ACQUIRING ACTUAL REAL-TIME SHOPPER BEHAVIOR DATA DURING A SHOPPER'S PRODUCT SELECTION
column13: The invention provides systems of acquiring actual real-time shopper behavior data during product selection by a shopper in a store. More specifically, disclosed herein are systems of using a communications network, a First Moment of Truth device and a data collections device to track actual real-time shopper behavior data relating to the presumed locations of shoppers in a store, the time spent and location of time spent by a shopper while considering a product for selection and products chosen for purchase.

column12: MEDICAL LEAD CONNECTOR SYSTEM
column13: An implantable medical device system including an implantable electronic device having multiple electrical connectors and an associated electrical lead also having a corresponding set of electrical connectors which engage with the connectors on the device. The lead has a connector assembly mounted to its proximal end, including the lead's electrical connectors and a mechanical connector. The device has a connector block with a bore extending therethrough sized to receive the connector assembly of the lead. A pulling tool is provided for pulling the lead connector assembly proximally in the bore of said connector block from a first position in which the lead's connector assembly is not fully inserted in the connector block to a second position in which said connector assembly is fully inserted in the connector block, the pulling tool being provided with a mechanical connector which engages with mechanical connector on the lead's connector assembly.

column12: Systems for store associate management in a store
column13: Described herein is a system for managing at least one store associate in the operation of a store through wireless electronic communication through a communication network between a manager and at least one store associate. The manager uses a manager's communication device and the at least one store associate uses an associate's communication device to communicate through the communication network. The store associate is provided a list of orders to perform and the manager receives data on the manager's communication device pertaining to the performance of the list of orders created on the associate's communication device, wherein the manager uses said data to evaluate the job performance of the at least one store associate.
column15: BRACEWELL BONNER BRETT;;EDWARD OSBORNE JOHN;;TODD HJELM CHRISTOPHER;;TITUS JONES ARTHUR;;BRENT PERKINS DION

column12: EXTRAVASCULAR ARRHYTHMIA INDUCTION
column13: A cardiac arrhythmia may be induced by delivering a sequence of pulses to a patient via one or more extravascular electrodes. In one example, one or more pacing pulses may be delivered to a patient via an extravascular electrode and a shock pulse may be delivered to the patient the extravascular electrode. In some examples, the pacing pulses and the shock pulse may be generated with energy from a common energy storage module and without interim charging of the module. For example, the pacing and shock pulses may be generated as the energy storage module dissipates. In another example, a cardiac arrhythmia may be induced in a patient by delivering a burst of pulses to a patient via an extravascular electrode. In some cases, the burst of pulses may be generated with energy from a common energy storage module and without interim charging of the energy storage module.

column12: Extravascular arrhythmia induction
column13: A cardiac arrhythmia may be induced by delivering a sequence of pulses to a patient via one or more extravascular electrodes. In one example, one or more pacing pulses may be delivered to a patient via an extravascular electrode and a shock pulse may be delivered to the patient the extravascular electrode. In some examples, the pacing pulses and the shock pulse may be generated with energy from a common energy storage module and without interim charging of the module. For example, the pacing and shock pulses may be generated as the energy storage module dissipates. In another example, a cardiac arrhythmia may be induced in a patient by delivering a burst of pulses to a patient via an extravascular electrode. In some cases, the burst of pulses may be generated with energy from a common energy storage module and without interim charging of the energy storage module.

column12: Systems and methods for controlling shelf display units and for graphically presenting information on shelf display units
column13: Systems and methods for controlling shelf display units and for graphically presenting information on shelf display units are disclosed. A system includes one or more display units configured to be coupled to shelves of a modular shelving system, one or more processors communicatively coupled to the one or more display units, one or more memory components communicatively coupled to the one or more processors, and machine readable instructions stored in the one or more memory components. When executed by the one or more processors, the machine readable instructions cause the system to determine a product identifier corresponding to a product, identify one or more display units to update in response to determining the product identifier corresponding to the product, and update a graphical output of the one or more display units identified to be updated in response to identifying the one or more display units to update.

column13: sistema de obtenção de dados sobre o comportamento real e em tempo real do cliente durante a seleção de produtos. a presente invenção se refere aos sistemas de obtenção de dados sobre o comportamento real e em tempo real do cliente durante a seleção de produtos no interior de uma ioja. maís específicamente, são divulgados aqui sistemas para uso de uma rede de comunicação, de um dispositivo para mapeamento do primeiro momento da verdade e de um dísposítivo de coleta de dados para o rastreamento de dados sobre o comportamento real e em tempo real do cliente relacionados com as localizações presumidas dos clientes no interior de uma ioja, com o tempo consumido e com a localização do tempo consumido pelo cliente no momento decisório de compra.

column12: Method and apparatus for downhole signal communication and measurement through a metal tubular
column13: Systems and methods for downhole communication and measurement utilizing an improved metallic tubular having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore adapted to receive a run-in tool. The tubular including slotted stations to provide through-tubular signal transmission and/or reception. Hydraulic isolation between the interior and exterior of the tubular is provided by pressure barrier means at the slotted stations. Sensors and/or sources are mounted on the run-in tool, which is adapted for transmission through a drill string to engage within the tubular in alignment with the slotted stations. A run-in tool configuration includes a modulator for real-time wireless communication with the surface and/or remote downhole tools. A tubular and run-in tool configuration also includes inductive couplers for wireless signal data transfer. A method for measuring a formation characteristic utilizing a run-in tool adapted with an interchangeable end segment for multi-mode downhole transport. Methods for sealing an opening on the surface of a tubular having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore.
column15: CLARK BRIAN;;HUNKA JOHN;;FREY MARK T;;SMITH DAVID L;;RAMASWAMY DHANANJAY;;COLLINS ANTHONY;;BONNER STEPHEN

column12: AZEOTROPE-LIKE COMPOSITIONS OF TRICHLOROTRIFLUOROETHANE METHANOL ACETONE NITHOMETHANE AND HEXANE
column13: An azeotrope-like compsn. comprising trichlorotrifluoroethane, emthanol, acetone, nitromethane and hexane is prepd. Trichlorofluoroethane is pref. CFCl2CF2C1. Hexane is pref. n-hexane, 2- or 3-methyl pentane, 2,2- or 2,3-dimethylbutane, or a mixt. of isomers contg. at least 35 wt.% isohexane. The compsn. is useful as a vapor degreasing agent, printed circuit board detluxing agent, for cleaning solid surfaces.

column12: Inductively-coupled system for receiving a run-in tool
column13: Systems and methods for downhole communication and measurement utilizing an improved metallic tubular having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore adapted to receive a run-in tool. The tubular including slotted stations to provide through-tubular signal transmission and/or reception. Hydraulic isolation between the interior and exterior of the tubular is provided by pressure barrier means at the slotted stations. Sensors and/or sources are mounted on the run-in tool, which is adapted for transmission through a drill string to engage within the tubular in alignment with the slotted stations. A run-in tool configuration includes a modulator for real-time wireless communication with the surface and/or remote downhole tools. A tubular and run-in tool configuration also includes inductive couplers for wireless signal data transfer. A method for measuring a formation characteristic utilizing a run-in tool adapted with an interchangeable end segment for multi-mode downhole transport. Methods for sealing an opening on the surface of a tubular having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore.
column15: CLARK BRIAN;;HUNKA JOHN;;FREY MARK T;;SMITH DAVID L;;RAMASWAMY DHANANJAY;;COLLINS ANTHONY;;BONNER STEPHEN

column12: System of tracking the real time location of shoppers, associates, managers and vendors through a communication multi-network within a store
column13: The invention relates to one or more systems for locating a shopper's, associate's, manager's or vendor's presumed position in a store using a communication multi-network for communication in the store. Specifically, at least one location device is positioned in proximity to, for example, a shopper such that the shopper's presumed position about the store may be known continuously or upon demand to the store.
column15: BONNER BRETT BRACEWELL;;HJELM CHRISTOPHER TODD;;JONES TITUS ARTHUR;;OSBORNE II JOHN EDWARD;;PERKINS DION BRENT

column12: Methods of acquiring actual real-time shopper behavior data approximate to a moment of decision by a shopper
column13: The invention provides methods of acquiring actual real-time shopper behavior data during product selection of purchasable items by a shopper in a store. More specifically, disclosed herein are methods of using a communications multi-network, a First Moment of Truth device and a data collection device to track actual real-time shopper behavior data relating to the presumed locations of shoppers in a store, the time spent and location of time spent by a shopper while considering a purchasable item and products chosen for purchase.
column14: BONNER BRETT BRACEWELL;;HJELM CHRISTOPHER TODD;;JONES TITUS ARTHUR;;OSBORNE II JOHN EDWARD;;PERKINS DION BRENT;;SUNRISE R & D HOLDINGS LLC

column12: Azeotrope like compositions of trichlorotrifluoroethane, methanol, nitromethane and hexane.
column13: Azeotrope-like compositions which are suitable for cleaning solid surfaces such as printed circuit boards comprise from 84.3 to 93.8 weight percent of 1,1,2-tricholoro-1,2,2-trifluoroethane, from 5.6 to 6.6 weight percent of methanol, from 0.05 to 0.8 weight percent of nitromethane, and from 0.1 to 8.7 weight percent of a hexane. The compositions have a boiling point of 39.6°C at 0.1 MPa (760 mm Hg).
column15: WILSON DAVID PAUL;;BASU RAJAT SUBHRA;;PHAM HANG THANH;;LUND EARL A E;;BONNER JOHN KIRKWOOD

column12: 선반 디스플레이 유닛을 제어하고 선반 디스플레이 유닛 상의 정보를 그래픽으로 나타내는 시스템 및 방법
column13: 선반 디스플레이 유닛들을 제어하고, 선반 디스플레이 유닛들 상의 정보를 그래픽으로 나타내는 시스템들 및 방법들이 개시된다. 상기 시스템은 모듈러 선반 시스템의 선반들에 결합되도록 구성된 하나 이상의 디스플레이 유닛들, 상기 하나 이상의 디스플레이 유닛들에 통신 가능하게 결합된 하나 이상의 프로세서들, 상기 하나 이상의 프로세서들에 통신 가능하게 결합된 하나 이상의 메모리 컴포넌트들, 및 상기 하나 이상의 메모리 컴포넌트들에 저장된 기계 판독 가능 명령어들을 포함하며, 상기 기계 판독 가능 명령어들은 하나 이상의 프로세서들에 의해 실행될 시에, 시스템으로 하여금, 제품에 대응하는 제품 식별자를 결정하고, 상기 제품에 대응하는 제품 식별자를 결정하는 것에 응답하여, 업데이트할 하나 이상의 디스플레이 유닛들을 식별하며; 그리고 상기 업데이트할 하나 이상의 디스플레이 유닛들을 식별하는 것에 응답하여, 업데이트될 식별된 하나 이상의 디스플레이 유닛들의 그래픽 출력을 업데이트하게 한다.

column12: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR CONTROLLING SHELF DISPLAY UNITS AND FOR GRAPHICALLY PRESENTING INFORMATION ON SHELF DISPLAY UNITS
column13: Systems and methods for controlling shelf display units and for graphically presenting information on shelf display units are disclosed. A system includes one or more display units configured to be coupled to shelves of a modular shelving system, one or more processors communicatively coupled to the one or more display units, one or more memory components communicatively coupled to the one or more processors, and machine readable instructions stored in the one or more memory components. When executed by the one or more processors, the machine readable instructions cause the system to determine a product identifier corresponding to a product, identify one or more display units to update in response to determining the product identifier corresponding to the product, and update a graphical output of the one or more display units identified to be updated in response to identifying the one or more display units to update.

column12: METHODS OF ACQUIRING ACTUAL REAL-TIME SHOPPER BEHAVIOR DATA APPROXIMATE TO A MOMENT OF DECISION BY A SHOPPER
column13: The invention provides methods of acquiring actual real-time shopper behavior data during product selection of purchasable items by a shopper in a store. More specifically, disclosed herein are methods of using a communications multi-network, a First Moment of Truth device and a data collection device to track actual real-time shopper behavior data relating to the presumed locations of shoppers in a store, the time spent and location of time spent by a shopper while considering a purchasable item and products chosen for purchase.

column12: AZEOTROPE LIKE COMPOSITIONS OF TRICHLOROTRIFLUOROETHANE, METHANOL, NITROMETHANE AND HEXANE
column13: Azeotrope-like compositions which are suitable for cleaning solid surfaces such as printed circuit boards comprise from 84.3 to 93.8 weight percent of 1,1,2-tricholoro-1,2,2-trifluoroethane, from 5.6 to 6.6 weight percent of methanol, from 0.05 to 0.8 weight percent of nitromethane, and from 0.1 to 8.7 weight percent of a hexane. The compositions have a boiling point of 39.6°C at 0.1 MPa (760 mm Hg).

column12: POLYMER ARTICLES AND PROCESS FOR FABRICATION THEREOF
column13: The present invention provides a polymeric article formed from oriented polymeric strands (52) made using a hot compaction process and in which layers of said strands are lain one-on-top of the other and the bond therebetween is improved by the inclusion of a plurality of particles (108) spread across the confronting surfaces prior to bonding. The particles have a higher melting point than the oriented polymeric strands. The particles may be embedded in a polymer layer (54) prior to insertion between said surfaces.

column12: Downhole tubular with openings for signal passage
column13: Systems and methods for downhole communication and measurement utilizing an improved metallic tubular having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore adapted to receive a run-in tool. The tubular including slotted stations to provide through-tubular signal transmission and/or reception. Hydraulic isolation between the interior and exterior of the tubular is provided by pressure barrier means at the slotted stations. Sensors and/or sources are mounted on the run-in tool, which is adapted for transmission through a drill string to engage within the tubular in alignment with the slotted stations. A run-in tool configuration includes a modulator for real-time wireless communication with the surface and/or remote downhole tools. A tubular and run-in tool configuration also includes inductive couplers for wireless signal data transfer. A method for measuring a formation characteristic utilizing a run-in tool adapted with an interchangeable end segment for multi-mode downhole transport. Methods for sealing an opening on the surface of a tubular having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore.

column12: TEMPERATURE MEASUREMENT OF STATIONARY PART ON ELECTRIC MACHINE BY USING FIBER OPTICS
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a sensor(10) for measuring temperature of stationary parts on an electric machine by using fiber optics.

SOLUTION: In this sensor, the fiber optics(16) is embedded in a nonmetallic ribbon(14), while a notch(20) is cut into the ribbon in order to form a flection fitting in the shape of the stationary part. Then the ribbon and the fiber optics are attached to the stationary part. Thus a series of laser pulse can be injected from at least one edge of the fiber optics to monitor the temperature of the stationary part through status display of reflection caused by the series of laser pulse.

column15: KAMINSKI CHRISTOPHER ANTHONY;;WEEBER KONRAD ROMAN;;BONNER THOMAS;;WETZEL TODD G;;DEVITT JOHN WILLIAM;;RAJENDRAN VEERA PALANIVELU

column12: Temperaturmessung in stationären Komponenten elektrischer Maschinen unter Verwendung von Glasfaseroptik
column13: Ein Sensor (10) misst die Temperatur in stationären Komponenten elektrischer Maschinen unter Verwendung von Glasfaseroptik. Eine optische Faser (16) ist in einem nicht metallischen Band (14) eingebettet. Kerben (20) sind in das Band geschnitten, um Krümmungen zu ermöglichen, die sich einer Gestalt einer stationären Komponente anpassen. Das Band und die optische Faser werden an der stationären Komponente angebracht. Eine Serie von Laserimpulsen kann von mindestens einem Ende der optischen Faser her eingebracht werden, und die Temperatur der stationären Komponente kann durch Abfrage von Reflexionen der Serie von Laserimpulsen überwacht werden.

column12: TARGET ACTIVATED MICRODISSECTION
column13: A method of removing a target from a biological sample, comprising: providing a substrate-mounted biological sample with a reagent that selectively acts on the target within the biological sample, wherein the reagent comprises an agent that absorbs light of a wavelength that selectively heats the reagent; placing a flexible transfer film having a lower surface and an opposing upper surface such that the lower surface of the transfer film is adjacent to the biological sample; applying a uniform air pressure gradient across the flexible transfer film to maintain thermal contact between the lower surface of the transfer film and the biological sample; exposing the biological sample to the light of the wavelength to selectively heat the reagent and produce a change in the transfer film resulting in selectively adhering the target to the transfer film; and selectively removing the target from the biological sample by removing the transfer film with the adhered target from the biological sample.
column15: BONNER ROBERT F;;MORGAN NICOLE Y;;POHIDA THOMAS J;;MCQUEEN PHILIP G;;PURSLEY RANDALL H;;KAKAREKA JOHN

column12: Measuring temperature in stationary components of electrical machines using fiber optics
column15: ANTHONY KAMINSKI CHRISTOPHER;;ROMAN WEEBER KONRAD;;THOMAS BONNER;;GARETT WETZEL TODD;;WILLIAM DEVITT JOHN;;PALANIVELU RAJENDRAN VEERA

column12: Optical fibre temperature sensor for electrical machine components
column13: A sensor 10 measures temperature in stationary components such as an armature bar 18 of electrical machines such as motors using fiber optics. An optical fiber 16 is embedded in a non-metallic ribbon or tape 14. Notches (Fig.1, 20) are cut in the ribbon to effect bends that accommodate a shape of a stationary component. The ribbon and optical fiber are attached to the stationary component. A series of laser pulses can be injected from at least one end of the optical fiber, and the stationary component temperature can be monitored by interrogation of reflections from the series of laser pulses. The optical fibre may be embedded in the ribbon in a sinusoidal configuration.

column12: INJECTION NEEDLE HAVING LATERAL DELIVERY PORTS AND METHOD FOR THE MANUFACTURE THEREOF
column13: An injection needle (10) comprises an elongated body (12) having an outer surface (18) and an inner surface (20) defining a longitudinal channel (22) through the tubular body. The elongated body (12) further comprises a distal end (16) and at least one lateral delivery port (28, 30, 32, 34) extending from the inner surface (20) to the outer surface (18) proximate the distal end (16) and fluidly coupled to the longitudinal channel (22). A distal tip (26) is coupled to the distal end (16) and comprises a radio-opaque material.

column12: DOWNHOLE SIGNAL COMMUNICATION AND MEASUREMENT THROUGH A METAL TUBULAR
column13: Systems and methods for downhole communication and measurement utilizing an improved metallic tubular (30) having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore (32) adapted to receive a run-in tool (10). The tubular including slotted stations to provide through- tubular signal transmission and/or reception. Hydraulic isolation between the interior and exterior of the tubular is provided by pressure barrier means at the slotted stations. Sensors and/or sources are mounted on the run-in tool, which is adapted for transmission through a drill string to engage within the tubular in alignment with the slotted stations. A run-in tool configuration includes a modulator for real-time wireless communication with the surface and/or remote downhole tools. A tubular and run-in tool configuration also includes inductive couplers (122) for wireless signal data transfer. A method for measuring a formation characteristic utilizing a run-in tool adapted with an interchangeable end segment for multi-mode downhole transport. Methods for sealing an opening (38) on the surface of a tubular having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore.

column12: SYSTEM OF ACQUIRING SHOPPER INSIGHTS AND INFLUENCING SHOPPER PURCHASE DECISIONS
column13: Systems herein relate to acquiring shopper insights from home product use and influencing shoppers to make additional future purchases of products. Further, the invention relates to electronically communicating with the shopper at the second moment of truth to provide the shopper with one or more influential messages including, but not limited to product information, e-coupons, discounts, surveys, ingredients, ingredient suggestions, recipe suggestions, entertaining, consumer reports, shopping list suggestions, wish list suggestions, and inventory list suggestions.
column14: SUNRISE R & D HOLDINGS LLC;;BONNER BRETT BRACEWELL;;HJELM CHRISTOPHER TODD;;JONES TITUS ARTHUR;;MENZ GREGORY MICHAEL;;OSBORNE JOHN EDWARD;;PERKINS DION BRENT

column12: SYSTEMS OF INFLUENCING SHOPPER'S PRODUCT SELECTION AT THE FIRST MOMENT OF TRUTH BASED UPON A SHOPPER'S LOCATION IN A RETAIL ESTABLISHMENT
column13: Provided herein is a system or systems for influencing shoppers while they consider making purchasing decisions in a retail establishment. Specifically, the method identifies the first moment of truth and attempts to influence shoppers during a shopper's first moment of truth based on the shopper's location within the retail establishment. The method transmits an acceptable influential message and transmits the message through a communication network to a shopper tracking device, which is in close proximity to a shopper during a shopping trip throughout a retail establishment.
column15: BONNER BRETT BRACEWELL;;HJELM CHRISTOPHER TODD;;JONES TITUS ARTHUR;;OSBORNE JOHN EDWARD;;PERKINS DION BRENT;;MENZ GREGORY MICHAEL

column12: 모듈러 선반 시스템, 자성 전기 커넥터, 전도체 조립체, 및 장착 삽입부
column13: 모듈러 선반 시스템들, 자성 전기 커넥터들, 전도체 조립체들, 및 장착 삽입부들이 개시된다. 모듈러 선반 시스템은 적어도 하나의 선반 모듈, 적어도 하나의 선반 모듈에 결합된 전력 모듈, 및 적어도 하나의 선반 모듈에 결합되고 전력 모듈에 전기적으로 연결된 전도체 조립체를 포함한다. 전도체 조립체는 제 1 열의 구멍들 및 제 2 열의 구멍들을 포함한 보드, 강자성 재료로 또는 자성 재료로 형성된 후면 판, 전력 모듈에 전기적으로 결합되고 후면 판과 보드 사이에 위치된 제 1 전도체, 및 전력 모듈에 전기적으로 결합되고 후면 판과 보드 사이에 위치된 제 2 전도체를 포함한다. 제 1 전도체는 보드의 제 1 열의 구멍들과 정렬된다. 제 2 전도체는 보드의 제 2 열의 구멍들과 정렬된다.

column12: TECHNIQUES FOR PLACING MEDICAL LEADS FOR ELECTRICAL STIMULATION OF NERVE TISSUE
column13: This disclosure is directed to extra, intra, and transvascular medical lead placement techniques for arranging medical leads and electrical stimulation and/or sensing electrodes proximate nerve tissue within a patient. It discloses an implantable medical lead system configured to deliver electrical stimulation to nerve tissue within a patient, the system comprising: an implantable medical lead comprising a distal portion configured for introduction into a sheath of tissue that contains the nerve tissue; an electrode electrically connected to the distal portion of the implantable medical lead; and an anchor connected to the medical lead and proximally offset from the electrode at least partially outside of the sheath to stabilize placement of the distal portion of the lead within the sheath.

column12: Downhole signal communication and measurement through a metal tubular
column13: Systems and methods for downhole communication and measurement utilizing an improved metallic tubular (30) having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore (32) adapted to receive a run-in tool (10). The tubular including slotted stations to provide through-tubular signal transmission and/or reception. Hydraulic isolation between the interior and exterior of the tubular is provided by pressure barrier means at the slotted stations. Sensors and/or sources are mounted on the run-in tool, which is adapted for transmission through a drill string to engage within the tubular in alignment with the slotted stations. A run-in tool configuration includes a modulator for real-time wireless communication with the surface and/or remote downhole tools. A tubular and run-in tool configuration also includes inductive couplers (122) for wireless signal data transfer. A method for measuring a formation characteristic utilizing a run-in tool adapted with an interchangeable end segment for multi-mode downhole transport. Methods for sealing an opening (38) on the surface of a tubular having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore.

column12: MODULAR SHELVING SYSTEMS, MAGNETIC ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS, CONDUCTOR ASSEMBLIES, AND MOUNTING INSERTS
column13: Modular shelving systems, magnetic electrical connectors, conductor assemblies, and mounting inserts are disclosed. A modular shelving system includes at least one shelving module, a power module coupled to the at least one shelving module, and a conductor assembly coupled to the at least one shelving module and electrically connected to the power module. The conductor assembly includes a board including a first column of apertures and a second column of apertures, a back plate formed from a ferromagnetic material or from a magnetic material, a first conductor electrically coupled to the power module and positioned between the back plate and the board, and a second conductor electrically coupled to the power module and positioned between the back plate and the board. The first conductor is aligned with the first column of apertures of the board. The second conductor is aligned with the second column of apertures of the board.

column12: EXOSOMES FOR DELIVERY OF THERAPEUTIC AGENTS
column13: The present invention provides exosomes as drug delivery vehicles, compositions comprising a therapeutic agent encapsulated within such exosomes, methods of producing such exosomes and compositions thereof, as well as methods of delivering such exosomes and compositions to a specific patient tissue or organ. The present invention also provides methods of treating a disease, disorder, or condition such as cancer, an inflammatory disease, an infectious disease, an allergic disease, or an autoimmune disease, comprising administering to a patient in need thereof a provided therapeutic-loaded exosome or a pharmaceutical composition thereof.

column12: METHODS OF INFLUENCING SHOPPERS AT THE FIRST MOMENT OF TRUTH IN A RETAIL ESTABLISHMENT
column13: Provided herein are systems and methods for influencing shoppers while they consider making purchasing decisions in a retail establishment. Specifically, the systems and methods for influencing shoppers may occur during a shopper's first moment of truth by transmitting through a communication network one or more influential messages to a handheld wireless electronic device or intelligent shopping cart, which is in close proximity to a shopper during a shopping trip throughout a retail establishment.

column12: MODULAR SHELVING SYSTEMS, MAGNETIC ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS, CONDUCTOR ASSEMBLIES, AND MOUNTING INSERTS
column13: Modular shelving systems, magnetic electrical connectors, conductor assemblies, and mounting inserts are disclosed. A modular shelving system includes at least one shelving module, a power module coupled to the at least one shelving module, and a conductor assembly coupled to the at least one shelving module and electrically connected to the power module. The conductor assembly includes a board including a first column of apertures and a second column of apertures, a back plate formed from a ferromagnetic material or from a magnetic material, a first conductor electrically coupled to the power module and positioned between the back plate and the board, and a second conductor electrically coupled to the power module and positioned between the back plate and the board. The first conductor is aligned with the first column of apertures of the board. The second conductor is aligned with the second column of apertures of the board.

column12: ORIENTATED POLYMERIC DEVICES
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To prevent device failure due to insufficient fixation of the device to bone.SOLUTION: A shape memory polymer material contains at least one two-dimensional region, which has a first amount of stored stress in a first direction and a second amount of stored stress higher than the first amount of stored stress in a second direction, where the two-dimensional region is capable of changing shape in only one of the first and second directions. For example, a sleeve of shape memory polymer material 31 is coupled to an interface portion 42 of an internal fixation device 41, such as an intramedullary nail, and the internal fixation device is inserted into bone 51. The sleeve is then provided with energy to deform the sleeve. A decrease in an inner diameter 31a of the sleeve causes the sleeve to grip the device, and an increase in an outer diameter 31b causes the outer diameter to contact the bone, thereby filling a gap 61 between the bone and the fixation device.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 4A

column12: Nedihulls signalkommunikasjon og maling gjennom en metallrordel.
column13: Oppfinnelsen vedrører utstyr for å motta et innføringsverksøy (10). Utstyret omfatter en sub (30) med et langsfrakt legeme med rørformede vegger og en sentral utboring (32). Suben er utført for å utgjøre et parti av en boresfrenglengde og omfatter minst en substasjon med minst en sliss (38) utformet på denne stasjon på en slik måte at den fiillstendig trenger gjennom rørveggen slik at det dannes en kontinuerlig kanal for passasje av et signal. Innføringsverktøyet er innrettet for å overføres gjennom borestrengen og inn i subens sentralutboring. Videre beskrives en fremgangsmåte for å sende ut og/eller motta et signal gjennom en jordformasjon. Fremgangsmåten omfatter utboring av et borehull gjennom jordformasjonen ved hjelp av en borestreng, anbringelse av innføringsverktøy (10) i inngrep inn i suben, plassering av innføringsverktøyet inne i suben, og utsendelse eller mottakelse av et signal som forplantes gjennom formasjonen, henholdsvis ved hjelp av sendermiddelet eller mottaksmiddelet.
column15: BONNER STEPHEN D;;CLARK BRIAN;;FREY MARK T;;COLLINS ANTHONY L;;HUNKA JOHN;;SMITH DAVID L;;RAMASWAMAY DHANANJAY

column12: Downhole signal communication and measurement through a metal tubular
column13: Systems and methods for downhole communication and measurement utilizing an improved metallic tubular (30) having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore (32) adapted to receive a run-in tool (10). The tubular including slotted stations to provide through-tubular signal transmission and/or reception. Hydraulic isolation between the interior and exterior of the tubular is provided by pressure barrier means at the slotted stations. Sensors and/or sources are mounted on the run-in tool, which is adapted for transmission through a drill string to engage within the tubular in alignment with the slotted stations. A run-in tool configuration includes a modulator for real-time wireless communication with the surface and/or remote downhole tools. A tubular and run-in tool configuration also includes inductive couplers (122) for wireless signal data transfer. A method for measuring a formation characteristic utilizing a run-in tool adapted with an interchangeable end segment for multi-mode downhole transport. Methods for sealing an opening (38) on the surface of a tubular having an elongated body with tubular walls and a central bore.

The first conductor is aligned with the first column of apertures of the board. The second conductor is aligned with the second column of apertures of the board.

column12: método para influenciar clientes no momento da decisão em um estabelecimento de varejo
column13: método para influenciar clientes no momento da decisão em um estabelecimento de varejo a invenção se refere a um sistema e método para influenciar os decisões de consumidores a compra em um pensar, enquanto estabelecimento eles tomam varejista. especificamente, os sistemas e métodos para influenciar os consumidores podem atuar no primeiro momento da verdade de um consumidor por meio de transmissão de uma ou mais mensagens influentes para um dispositivo eletrônico portátil sem fio ou um carrinho de compras inteligente através de uma rede de comunicação que fica nas proximidades de um consumidor durante um passeio por um estabelecimento de varejo.

column12: sistemas para influenciar a seleção de produto pelo comprador no primeiro momento da verdade com base em uma localização do comprador em um estabelecimento de varejo
column13: sistemas para influenciar a seleção de produto pelo comprador no primeiro momento da verdade com base em uma localização do comprador em um estabelecimento de varejo. trata-se de um sistema ou sistemas para influenciar compradores enquanto os mesmos consideram tomar decisões de compra em um estabelecimento de varejo. especificamente, o método identifica o primeiro momento da verdade e tenta influenciar compradores durante um primeiro momento da verdade do comprador baseado na localização do comprador no estabelecimento de varejo. o método transmite uma mensagem influente aceitável e transmite a mensagem através de uma rede de comunicação para um dispositivo rastreador de comprador, que está proximo a um comprador durante um percurso de compra por um estabelecimento de varejo.

column13: 본 발명은 림프계 유도 지질 전구약물, 이의 약제학적 조성물, 이러한 전구약물 및 조성물 제조 방법, 및 지질 전구약물의 일부를 포함하는 치료제의 생체이용률 및 기타 특성을 개선하는 방법을 제공한다. 본 발명은 또한 개시된 지질 전구약물 또는 이의 약제학적 조성물을 이를 필요로 하는 환자에게 투여하는 것을 포함하는, 본원엔 개시된 것과 같은 질환, 장애 또는 병태 치료 방법을 제공한다.

column12: System of acquiring shopper insights and influencing shopper purchase decisions
column13: Systems herein relate to acquiring shopper insights from home product use and influencing shoppers to make additional future purchases of products. Further, the invention relates to electronically communicating with the shopper at the second moment of truth to provide the shopper with one or more influential messages including, but not limited to product information, e-coupons, discounts, surveys, ingredients, ingredient suggestions, recipe suggestions, entertaining, consumer reports, shopping list suggestions, wish list suggestions, and inventory list suggestions.

column12: System of Acquiring Shopper Insights and Influencing Shopper Purchase Decisions
column13: Systems herein relate to acquiring shopper insights from home product use and influencing shoppers to make additional future purchases of products. Further, the invention relates to electronically communicating with the shopper at the second moment of truth to provide the shopper with one or more influential messages including, but not limited to product information, e-coupons, discounts, surveys, ingredients, ingredient suggestions, recipe suggestions, entertaining, consumer reports, shopping list suggestions, wish list suggestions, and inventory list suggestions.

column12: Systems of influencing shopper's product selection at the first moment of truth based upon a shopper's location in a retail establishment
column13: A system of influencing a shopper's product selection based upon the shopper's location in a retail establishment, comprising: i) a communications multi-network positioned about the retail establishment, the communications multi-network comprising at least one mesh communication network and at least one star communication network; ii) a logic engine operatively connected to the communications multi-network, the logic engine managing the communications multi-network; and iii) a shopper tracking device positioned into close proximity to the shopper whereby the shopper tracking device creates shopper location data, the shopper tracking device being in tracked communication through the at least one mesh communication network of the communications multi-network with the logic engine; whereby the logic engine creates at least one influential message based upon shopper behavior data and the shopper location data and delivers the at least one influential message through the star communication network to the shopper to lead the shopper away from a high traffic area, wherein the influential message comprises targeted product information concerning a targeted product located distant to a shopper location represented by the shopper location data collected by the logic engine. column12: sistema para influenciar clientes no momento da decisão em um estabelecimento de varejo
column13: sistema para influenciar clientes no momento da decisão em um estabelecimento de varejo a invenção se refere a um sistema e método para influenciar os consumidores a pensar, enquanto eles tomam decisões de compra em um estabelecimento varejista. especificamente, os sistemas e métodos para influenciar os consumidores podem atuar no primeiro momento da verdade de um consumidor por meio de transmissão de uma ou mais mensagens influentes para um dispositivo eletrônico portátil sem fio ou um carrinho de compras inteligente através de uma rede de comunicação que fica nas proximidades de um consumidor durante um passeio por um estabelecimento de varejo .

column12: SYSTEMS OF INFLUENCING SHOPPER'S PRODUCT SELECTION AT THE FIRST MOMENT OF TRUTH BASED UPON A SHOPPER'S LOCATION IN A RETAIL ESTABLISHMENT
column13: Provided herein is a system or systems for influencing shoppers while they consider making purchasing decisions in a retail establishment. Specifically, the method identifies the first moment of truth and attempts to influence shoppers during a shopper's first moment of truth based on the shopper's location within the retail establishment. The method transmits an acceptable influential message and transmits the message through a communication network to a shopper tracking device, which is in close proximity to a shopper during a shopping trip throughout a retail establishment.

column12: SYSTEMS OF INFLUENCING SHOPPERS AT THE FIRST MOMENT OF TRUTH IN A RETAIL ESTABLISHMENT
column13: Provided herein are systems and methods for influencing shoppers while they consider making purchasing decisions in a retail establishment. Specifically, the systems and methods for influencing shoppers may occur during a shopper's first moment of truth by transmitting through a communication network one or more influential messages to a handheld wireless electronic device or intelligent shopping cart, which is in close proximity to a shopper during a shopping trip throughout a retail establishment.
column15: BONNER BRETT BRACEWELL;;HJELM CHRISTOPHER TODD;;JONES TITUS ARTHUR;;OSBORNE JOHN EDWARD II;;PERKINS DION BRENT;;MENZ GREGORY MICHAEL

column12: INTERVENTIONAL MEDICAL DEVICE AND METHOD OF USE
column13: A relatively compact implantable medical device includes a fixation member formed by a plurality of fingers mounted around a perimeter of a distal end of a housing of the device; each finger is elastically deformable from a relaxed condition to an extended condition, to accommodate delivery of the device to a target implant site, and from the relaxed condition to a compressed condition, to accommodate wedging of the fingers between opposing tissue surfaces at the target implant site, wherein the compressed fingers hold a cardiac pacing electrode of the device in intimate tissue contact for the delivery of pacing stimulation to the site. Each fixation finger is preferably configured to prevent penetration thereof within the tissue when the fingers are compressed and wedged between the opposing tissue surfaces. The pacing electrode may be mounted on a pacing extension, which extends distally from the distal end of the device housing.
column15: EGGEN MICHAEL D;;CARNEY JAMES K;;BONNER MATTHEW D;;GRUBAC VLADIMIR;;HINE DOUGLAS S;;BROSTROM THOMAS D;;SOMMER JOHN L

column12: METHOD OF RECLAIMING PRODUCTS FROM A RETAIL STORE
column13: A method of reclaiming products from a retail store includes passing a plurality of products through an object identification system, capturing images of the plurality of products with object sensors as the products pass through the object identification system, processing the images to identify an indicium for each product, transmitting the indicium for each product through a wireless communication network to a logic engine, sorting the plurality of products based on the indicia to produce a bundled lot of products, producing a unique identifier for the bundled lot, the unique identifier having a machine readable code, and communicating the unique identifier of the bundled lot and the indicia of the products in the bundled lot to an auctioneer for initiation of a direct-to-consumer auction for auctioning of the bundled lot directly to a group of bidders.
